     106             : struct TabWidth {
     107             :   TabWidth(uint32_t aOffset, uint32_t aWidth)
     108           1 :     : mOffset(aOffset), mWidth(float(aWidth))
     109             :   { }
     110             : 
     111             :   uint32_t mOffset; // DOM offset relative to the current frame's offset.
     112             :   float    mWidth;  // extra space to be added at this position (in app units)
     113             : };
     114             : 
     115           1 : struct TabWidthStore {
     116             :   explicit TabWidthStore(int32_t aValidForContentOffset)
     117             :     : mLimit(0)
     118           1 :     , mValidForContentOffset(aValidForContentOffset)
     119             :   { }
     120             : 
     121             :   // Apply tab widths to the aSpacing array, which corresponds to characters
     122             :   // beginning at aOffset and has length aLength. (Width records outside this
     123             :   // range will be ignored.)
     124             :   void ApplySpacing(gfxTextRun::PropertyProvider::Spacing *aSpacing,
     125             :                     uint32_t aOffset, uint32_t aLength);
     126             : 
     127             :   // Offset up to which tabs have been measured; positions beyond this have not
     128             :   // been calculated yet but may be appended if needed later.  It's a DOM
     129             :   // offset relative to the current frame's offset.
     130             :   uint32_t mLimit;
     131             : 
     132             :   // Need to recalc tab offsets if frame content offset differs from this.
     133             :   int32_t mValidForContentOffset;
     134             : 
     135             :   // A TabWidth record for each tab character measured so far.
     136             :   nsTArray<TabWidth> mWidths;
     137             : };
     138             : 
     139             : namespace {
     140             : 
     141             : struct TabwidthAdaptor
     142             : {
     143             :   const nsTArray<TabWidth>& mWidths;
     144             :   explicit TabwidthAdaptor(const nsTArray<TabWidth>& aWidths)
     145           1 :     : mWidths(aWidths) {}
     146           1 :   uint32_t operator[](size_t aIdx) const {
     147           1 :     return mWidths[aIdx].mOffset;
     148             :   }
     149             : };
     150             : 
     151             : } // namespace
     152             : 
     153             : void
     154           1 : TabWidthStore::ApplySpacing(gfxTextRun::PropertyProvider::Spacing *aSpacing,
     155             :                             uint32_t aOffset, uint32_t aLength)
     156             : {
     157           1 :   size_t i = 0;
     158           1 :   const size_t len = mWidths.Length();
     159             : 
     160             :   // If aOffset is non-zero, do a binary search to find where to start
     161             :   // processing the tab widths, in case the list is really long. (See bug
     162             :   // 953247.)
     163             :   // We need to start from the first entry where mOffset >= aOffset.
     164           1 :   if (aOffset > 0) {
     165           1 :     mozilla::BinarySearch(TabwidthAdaptor(mWidths), 0, len, aOffset, &i);
     166             :   }
     167             : 
     168           1 :   uint32_t limit = aOffset + aLength;
     169           1 :   while (i < len) {
     170           1 :     const TabWidth& tw = mWidths[i];
     171           1 :     if (tw.mOffset >= limit) {
     172             :       break;
     173             :     }
     174           1 :     aSpacing[tw.mOffset - aOffset].mAfter += tw.mWidth;
     175           1 :     i++;
     176             :   }
     177           1 : }

     203           1 : static const nsFrameState TEXT_REFLOW_FLAGS =
     204             :    TEXT_FIRST_LETTER |
     205             :    TEXT_START_OF_LINE |
     206             :    TEXT_END_OF_LINE |
     207             :    TEXT_HYPHEN_BREAK |
     208             :    TEXT_TRIMMED_TRAILING_WHITESPACE |
     209             :    TEXT_JUSTIFICATION_ENABLED |
     210             :    TEXT_HAS_NONCOLLAPSED_CHARACTERS |
     211           1 :    TEXT_SELECTION_UNDERLINE_OVERFLOWED |
     212             :    TEXT_NO_RENDERED_GLYPHS;
     213             : 
     214           1 : static const nsFrameState TEXT_WHITESPACE_FLAGS =
     215             :     TEXT_IS_ONLY_WHITESPACE |
     216             :     TEXT_ISNOT_ONLY_WHITESPACE;
     217             : 
     218             : /*
     219             :  * Some general notes
     220             :  *
     221             :  * Text frames delegate work to gfxTextRun objects. The gfxTextRun object
     222             :  * transforms text to positioned glyphs. It can report the geometry of the
     223             :  * glyphs and paint them. Text frames configure gfxTextRuns by providing text,
     224             :  * spacing, language, and other information.
     225             :  *
     226             :  * A gfxTextRun can cover more than one DOM text node. This is necessary to
     227             :  * get kerning, ligatures and shaping for text that spans multiple text nodes
     228             :  * but is all the same font.
     229             :  *
     230             :  * The userdata for a gfxTextRun object can be:
     231             :  *
     232             :  *   - A nsTextFrame* in the case a text run maps to only one flow. In this
     233             :  *   case, the textrun's user data pointer is a pointer to mStartFrame for that
     234             :  *   flow, mDOMOffsetToBeforeTransformOffset is zero, and mContentLength is the
     235             :  *   length of the text node.
     236             :  *
     237             :  *   - A SimpleTextRunUserData in the case a text run maps to one flow, but we
     238             :  *   still have to keep a list of glyph observers.
     239             :  *
     240             :  *   - A ComplexTextRunUserData in the case a text run maps to multiple flows,
     241             :  *   but we need to keep a list of glyph observers.
     242             :  *
     243             :  *   - A TextRunUserData in the case a text run maps multiple flows, but it
     244             :  *   doesn't have any glyph observer for changes in SVG fonts.
     245             :  *
     246             :  * You can differentiate between the four different cases with the
     247             :  * TEXT_IS_SIMPLE_FLOW and TEXT_MIGHT_HAVE_GLYPH_CHANGES flags.
     248             :  *
     249             :  * We go to considerable effort to make sure things work even if in-flow
     250             :  * siblings have different style contexts (i.e., first-letter and first-line).
     251             :  *
     252             :  * Our convention is that unsigned integer character offsets are offsets into
     253             :  * the transformed string. Signed integer character offsets are offsets into
     254             :  * the DOM string.
     255             :  *
     256             :  * XXX currently we don't handle hyphenated breaks between text frames where the
     257             :  * hyphen occurs at the end of the first text frame, e.g.
     258             :  *   <b>Kit&shy;</b>ty
     259             :  */
     260             : 
     261             : /**
     262             :  * This is our user data for the textrun, when textRun->GetFlags() has
     263             :  * TEXT_IS_SIMPLE_FLOW set, and also TEXT_MIGHT_HAVE_GLYPH_CHANGES.
     264             :  *
     265             :  * This allows having an array of observers if there are fonts whose glyphs
     266             :  * might change, but also avoid allocation in the simple case that there aren't.
     267             :  */
     268           0 : struct SimpleTextRunUserData {
     269             :   nsTArray<UniquePtr<GlyphObserver>> mGlyphObservers;
     270             :   nsTextFrame* mFrame;
     271             :   explicit SimpleTextRunUserData(nsTextFrame* aFrame)
     272           0 :     : mFrame(aFrame)
     273             :   {
     274             :   }
     275             : };
     276             : 
     277             : /**
     278             :  * We use an array of these objects to record which text frames
     279             :  * are associated with the textrun. mStartFrame is the start of a list of
     280             :  * text frames. Some sequence of its continuations are covered by the textrun.
     281             :  * A content textnode can have at most one TextRunMappedFlow associated with it
     282             :  * for a given textrun.
     283             :  *
     284             :  * mDOMOffsetToBeforeTransformOffset is added to DOM offsets for those frames to obtain
     285             :  * the offset into the before-transformation text of the textrun. It can be
     286             :  * positive (when a text node starts in the middle of a text run) or
     287             :  * negative (when a text run starts in the middle of a text node). Of course
     288             :  * it can also be zero.
     289             :  */
     290             : struct TextRunMappedFlow {
     291             :   nsTextFrame* mStartFrame;
     292             :   int32_t      mDOMOffsetToBeforeTransformOffset;
     293             :   // The text mapped starts at mStartFrame->GetContentOffset() and is this long
     294             :   uint32_t     mContentLength;
     295             : };
     296             : 
     297             : /**
     298             :  * This is the type in the gfxTextRun's userdata field in the common case that
     299             :  * the text run maps to multiple flows, but no fonts have been found with
     300             :  * animatable glyphs.
     301             :  *
     302             :  * This way, we avoid allocating and constructing the extra nsTArray.
     303             :  */
     304             : struct TextRunUserData {
     305             : #ifdef DEBUG
     306             :   TextRunMappedFlow* mMappedFlows;
     307             : #endif
     308             :   uint32_t           mMappedFlowCount;
     309             :   uint32_t           mLastFlowIndex;
     310             : };
     311             : 
     312             : /**
     313             :  * This is our user data for the textrun, when textRun->GetFlags() does not
     314             :  * have TEXT_IS_SIMPLE_FLOW set and has the TEXT_MIGHT HAVE_GLYPH_CHANGES flag.
     315             :  */
     316           0 : struct ComplexTextRunUserData : public TextRunUserData {
     317             :   nsTArray<UniquePtr<GlyphObserver>> mGlyphObservers;
     318             : };
     319             : 
     320             : /**
     321             :  * This helper object computes colors used for painting, and also IME
     322             :  * underline information. The data is computed lazily and cached as necessary.
     323             :  * These live for just the duration of one paint operation.
     324             :  */
     325           1 : class nsTextPaintStyle {
     326             : public:
     327             :   explicit nsTextPaintStyle(nsTextFrame* aFrame);

     369             : 
     370             :   // if this returns false, we don't need to draw underline.
     371             :   static bool GetSelectionUnderline(nsPresContext* aPresContext,
     372             :                                       int32_t aIndex,
     373             :                                       nscolor* aLineColor,
     374             :                                       float* aRelativeSize,
     375             :                                       uint8_t* aStyle);
     376             : 
     377             :   // if this returns false, no text-shadow was specified for the selection
     378             :   // and the *aShadow parameter was not modified.
     379             :   bool GetSelectionShadow(nsCSSShadowArray** aShadow);
     380             : 
     381             :   nsPresContext* PresContext() const { return mPresContext; }
     382             : 
     383             :   enum {
     384             :     eIndexRawInput = 0,
     385             :     eIndexSelRawText,
     386             :     eIndexConvText,
     387             :     eIndexSelConvText,
     388             :     eIndexSpellChecker
     389             :   };
     390             : 
     391           1 :   static int32_t GetUnderlineStyleIndexForSelectionType(
     392             :                    SelectionType aSelectionType)
     393             :   {
     394           1 :     switch (aSelectionType) {

     509             : static void
     510           1 : DestroyTextRunUserData(gfxTextRun* aTextRun)
     511             : {
     512             :   MOZ_ASSERT(aTextRun->GetUserData());
     513           1 :   if (aTextRun->GetFlags() & nsTextFrameUtils::TEXT_IS_SIMPLE_FLOW) {
     514           1 :     if (aTextRun->GetFlags() & nsTextFrameUtils::TEXT_MIGHT_HAVE_GLYPH_CHANGES) {
     515           0 :       delete static_cast<SimpleTextRunUserData*>(aTextRun->GetUserData());
     516             :     }
     517             :   } else {
     518           1 :     if (aTextRun->GetFlags() & nsTextFrameUtils::TEXT_MIGHT_HAVE_GLYPH_CHANGES) {
     519             :       DestroyComplexUserData(
     520           0 :         static_cast<ComplexTextRunUserData*>(aTextRun->GetUserData()));
     521             :     } else {
     522             :       DestroyUserData(
     523           1 :         static_cast<TextRunUserData*>(aTextRun->GetUserData()));
     524             :     }
     525             :   }
     526           1 :   aTextRun->ClearFlagBits(nsTextFrameUtils::TEXT_MIGHT_HAVE_GLYPH_CHANGES);
     527           1 :   aTextRun->SetUserData(nullptr);
     528           1 : }
     529             : 
     530             : static TextRunMappedFlow*
     531           1 : GetMappedFlows(const gfxTextRun* aTextRun)
     532             : {

     606             : /**
     607             :  * Kill all references to |aTextRun| starting at |aStartContinuation|.

     773             : // Smarter versions of dom::IsSpaceCharacter.
     774             : // Unicode is really annoying; sometimes a space character isn't whitespace ---
     775             : // when it combines with another character
     776             : // So we have several versions of IsSpace for use in different contexts.
     777             : 
     778           1 : static bool IsSpaceCombiningSequenceTail(const nsTextFragment* aFrag, uint32_t aPos)

     787             : // Check whether aPos is a space for CSS 'word-spacing' purposes

     850             : 
     851             : // Count the amount of trimmable whitespace (as per CSS
     852             : // 'white-space:normal/nowrap') in a text fragment. The first
     853             : // character is at offset aStartOffset; the maximum number of characters
     854             : // to check is aLength. aDirection is -1 or 1 depending on whether we should
     855             : // progress backwards or forwards.
     856             : static uint32_t
     857           1 : GetTrimmableWhitespaceCount(const nsTextFragment* aFrag,
     858             :                             int32_t aStartOffset, int32_t aLength,
     859             :                             int32_t aDirection)
     860             : {
     861           1 :   int32_t count = 0;
     862           1 :   if (aFrag->Is2b()) {
     863           1 :     const char16_t* str = aFrag->Get2b() + aStartOffset;
     864           1 :     int32_t fragLen = aFrag->GetLength() - aStartOffset;
     865           1 :     for (; count < aLength; ++count) {
     866           1 :       if (!IsTrimmableSpace(str, fragLen))
     867             :         break;
     868           1 :       str += aDirection;
     869           1 :       fragLen -= aDirection;
     870             :     }
     871             :   } else {
     872           1 :     const char* str = aFrag->Get1b() + aStartOffset;
     873           1 :     for (; count < aLength; ++count) {
     874           1 :       if (!IsTrimmableSpace(*str))
     875             :         break;
     876           1 :       str += aDirection;
     877             :     }
     878             :   }
     879           1 :   return count;
     880             : }
     881             : 
     882             : static bool
     883           1 : IsAllWhitespace(const nsTextFragment* aFrag, bool aAllowNewline)

     894             :   }
     895             :   return true;
     896             : }

     975             :

     977           0 :     observers->AppendElement(new GlyphObserver(font, aTextRun));
     978             :   }
     979             : }
     980             : 
     981             : /**
     982             :  * This class accumulates state as we scan a paragraph of text. It detects
     983             :  * textrun boundaries (changes from text to non-text, hard
     984             :  * line breaks, and font changes) and builds a gfxTextRun at each boundary.
     985             :  * It also detects linebreaker run boundaries (changes from text to non-text,
     986             :  * and hard line breaks) and at each boundary runs the linebreaker to compute
     987             :  * potential line breaks. It also records actual line breaks to store them in
     988             :  * the textruns.
     989             :  */
     990             : class BuildTextRunsScanner {
     991             : public:
     992           1 :   BuildTextRunsScanner(nsPresContext* aPresContext, DrawTarget* aDrawTarget,
     993             :       nsIFrame* aLineContainer, nsTextFrame::TextRunType aWhichTextRun) :
     994             :     mDrawTarget(aDrawTarget),
     995             :     mLineContainer(aLineContainer),

    1069             :   FindBoundaryResult FindBoundaries(nsIFrame* aFrame, FindBoundaryState* aState);
    1070             : 
    1071             :   bool ContinueTextRunAcrossFrames(nsTextFrame* aFrame1, nsTextFrame* aFrame2);
    1072             : 
    1073             :   // Like TextRunMappedFlow but with some differences. mStartFrame to mEndFrame
    1074             :   // (exclusive) are a sequence of in-flow frames (if mEndFrame is null, then
    1075             :   // continuations starting from mStartFrame are a sequence of in-flow frames).
    1076             :   struct MappedFlow {
    1077             :     nsTextFrame* mStartFrame;
    1078             :     nsTextFrame* mEndFrame;
    1079             :     // When we consider breaking between elements, the nearest common
    1080             :     // ancestor of the elements containing the characters is the one whose
    1081             :     // CSS 'white-space' property governs. So this records the nearest common
    1082             :     // ancestor of mStartFrame and the previous text frame, or null if there
    1083             :     // was no previous text frame on this line.
    1084             :     nsIFrame*    mAncestorControllingInitialBreak;
    1085             : 
    1086           1 :     int32_t GetContentEnd() {
    1087             :       return mEndFrame ? mEndFrame->GetContentOffset()
    1088           1 :           : mStartFrame->GetContent()->GetText()->GetLength();
    1089             :     }
    1090             :   };
    1091             : 
    1092           1 :   class BreakSink final : public nsILineBreakSink {

    1101           1 :     virtual void SetBreaks(uint32_t aOffset, uint32_t aLength,
    1102             :                            uint8_t* aBreakBefore) override {
    1103             :       gfxTextRun::Range range(aOffset + mOffsetIntoTextRun,
    1104           1 :                               aOffset + mOffsetIntoTextRun + aLength);

    1106             :         // Be conservative and assume that some breaks have been set
    1107           1 :         mTextRun->ClearFlagBits(nsTextFrameUtils::TEXT_NO_BREAKS);
    1108             :       }
    1109           1 :     }
    1110             : 
    1111           1 :     virtual void SetCapitalization(uint32_t aOffset, uint32_t aLength,
    1112             :                                    bool* aCapitalize) override {
    1113             :       MOZ_ASSERT(mTextRun->GetFlags() & nsTextFrameUtils::TEXT_IS_TRANSFORMED,

    1119           1 :                                               aCapitalize);
    1120             :       }
    1121           1 :     }
    1122             :

    1125             :                    "Flag set that should never be set! (memory safety error?)");

    1168             : static nsIFrame*
    1169           1 : FindLineContainer(nsIFrame* aFrame)
    1170             : {
    1171           1 :   while (aFrame && (aFrame->IsFrameOfType(nsIFrame::eLineParticipant) ||
    1172           1 :                     aFrame->CanContinueTextRun())) {
    1173           1 :     aFrame = aFrame->GetParent();
    1174             :   }
    1175           1 :   return aFrame;
    1176             : }
    1177             : 
    1178             : static bool
    1179           1 : IsLineBreakingWhiteSpace(char16_t aChar)
    1180             : {
    1181             :   // 0x0A (\n) is not handled as white-space by the line breaker, since
    1182             :   // we break before it, if it isn't transformed to a normal space.
    1183             :   // (If we treat it as normal white-space then we'd only break after it.)
    1184             :   // However, it does induce a line break or is converted to a regular
    1185             :   // space, and either way it can be used to bound the region of text
    1186             :   // that needs to be analyzed for line breaking.
    1187           1 :   return nsLineBreaker::IsSpace(aChar) || aChar == 0x0A;
    1188             : }
    1189             : 
    1190             : static bool
    1191           1 : TextContainsLineBreakerWhiteSpace(const void* aText, uint32_t aLength,
    1192             :                                   bool aIsDoubleByte)
    1193             : {
    1194           1 :   if (aIsDoubleByte) {
    1195             :     const char16_t* chars = static_cast<const char16_t*>(aText);
    1196           1 :     for (uint32_t i = 0; i < aLength; ++i) {
    1197           1 :       if (IsLineBreakingWhiteSpace(chars[i]))
    1198             :         return true;
    1199             :     }
    1200             :     return false;
    1201             :   } else {
    1202             :     const uint8_t* chars = static_cast<const uint8_t*>(aText);
    1203           1 :     for (uint32_t i = 0; i < aLength; ++i) {
    1204           1 :       if (IsLineBreakingWhiteSpace(chars[i]))
    1205             :         return true;
    1206             :     }
    1207             :     return false;
    1208             :   }
    1209             : }
    1210             : 
    1211             : struct FrameTextTraversal {
    1212             :   // These fields identify which frames should be recursively scanned
    1213             :   // The first normal frame to scan (or null, if no such frame should be scanned)
    1214             :   nsIFrame*    mFrameToScan;
    1215             :   // The first overflow frame to scan (or null, if no such frame should be scanned)
    1216             :   nsIFrame*    mOverflowFrameToScan;
    1217             :   // Whether to scan the siblings of mFrameToDescendInto/mOverflowFrameToDescendInto
    1218             :   bool mScanSiblings;
    1219             : 
    1220             :   // These identify the boundaries of the context required for
    1221             :   // line breaking or textrun construction
    1222             :   bool mLineBreakerCanCrossFrameBoundary;
    1223             :   bool mTextRunCanCrossFrameBoundary;
    1224             : 
    1225           1 :   nsIFrame* NextFrameToScan() {
    1226             :     nsIFrame* f;
    1227           1 :     if (mFrameToScan) {
    1228           1 :       f = mFrameToScan;
    1229           1 :       mFrameToScan = mScanSiblings ? f->GetNextSibling() : nullptr;
    1230           1 :     } else if (mOverflowFrameToScan) {
    1231           0 :       f = mOverflowFrameToScan;
    1232           0 :       mOverflowFrameToScan = mScanSiblings ? f->GetNextSibling() : nullptr;
    1233             :     } else {
    1234             :       f = nullptr;
    1235             :     }
    1236           1 :     return f;
    1237             :   }
    1238             : };
    1239             : 
    1240             : static FrameTextTraversal
    1241           1 : CanTextCrossFrameBoundary(nsIFrame* aFrame, nsIAtom* aType)
    1242             : {
    1243             :   NS_ASSERTION(aType == aFrame->GetType(), "Wrong type");
    1244             : 
    1245             :   FrameTextTraversal result;
    1246             : 
    1247           1 :   bool continuesTextRun = aFrame->CanContinueTextRun();
    1248           1 :   if (aType == nsGkAtoms::placeholderFrame) {
    1249             :     // placeholders are "invisible", so a text run should be able to span
    1250             :     // across one. But don't descend into the out-of-flow.
    1251           1 :     result.mLineBreakerCanCrossFrameBoundary = true;
    1252           1 :     result.mOverflowFrameToScan = nullptr;
    1253           1 :     if (continuesTextRun) {
    1254             :       // ... Except for first-letter floats, which are really in-flow
    1255             :       // from the point of view of capitalization etc, so we'd better
    1256             :       // descend into them. But we actually need to break the textrun for
    1257             :       // first-letter floats since things look bad if, say, we try to make a
    1258             :       // ligature across the float boundary.
    1259             :       result.mFrameToScan =
    1260           1 :         (static_cast<nsPlaceholderFrame*>(aFrame))->GetOutOfFlowFrame();
    1261           1 :       result.mScanSiblings = false;
    1262           1 :       result.mTextRunCanCrossFrameBoundary = false;
    1263             :     } else {
    1264           1 :       result.mFrameToScan = nullptr;
    1265           1 :       result.mTextRunCanCrossFrameBoundary = true;
    1266             :     }
    1267             :   } else {
    1268           1 :     if (continuesTextRun) {
    1269           1 :       result.mFrameToScan = aFrame->PrincipalChildList().FirstChild();
    1270             :       result.mOverflowFrameToScan =
    1271           1 :         aFrame->GetChildList(nsIFrame::kOverflowList).FirstChild();
    1272             :       NS_WARNING_ASSERTION(
    1273             :         !result.mOverflowFrameToScan,
    1274             :         "Scanning overflow inline frames is something we should avoid");
    1275           1 :       result.mScanSiblings = true;
    1276           1 :       result.mTextRunCanCrossFrameBoundary = true;
    1277           1 :       result.mLineBreakerCanCrossFrameBoundary = true;
    1278             :     } else {
    1279             :       MOZ_ASSERT(aType != nsGkAtoms::rubyTextContainerFrame,
    1280             :                  "Shouldn't call this method for ruby text container");
    1281           1 :       result.mFrameToScan = nullptr;
    1282           1 :       result.mOverflowFrameToScan = nullptr;
    1283           1 :       result.mTextRunCanCrossFrameBoundary = false;
    1284           1 :       result.mLineBreakerCanCrossFrameBoundary = false;
    1285             :     }
    1286             :   }
    1287           1 :   return result;
    1288             : }
    1289             : 
    1290             : BuildTextRunsScanner::FindBoundaryResult
    1291           1 : BuildTextRunsScanner::FindBoundaries(nsIFrame* aFrame, FindBoundaryState* aState)
    1292             : {
    1293           1 :   nsIAtom* frameType = aFrame->GetType();
    1294           1 :   if (frameType == nsGkAtoms::rubyTextContainerFrame) {
    1295             :     // Don't stop a text run for ruby text container. We want ruby text
    1296             :     // containers to be skipped, but continue the text run across them.
    1297             :     return FB_CONTINUE;
    1298             :   }
    1299             : 
    1300           1 :   nsTextFrame* textFrame = frameType == nsGkAtoms::textFrame
    1301           1 :     ? static_cast<nsTextFrame*>(aFrame) : nullptr;
    1302           1 :   if (textFrame) {
    1303           1 :     if (aState->mLastTextFrame &&
    1304           1 :         textFrame != aState->mLastTextFrame->GetNextInFlow() &&
    1305           1 :         !ContinueTextRunAcrossFrames(aState->mLastTextFrame, textFrame)) {
    1306           1 :       aState->mSeenTextRunBoundaryOnThisLine = true;
    1307           1 :       if (aState->mSeenSpaceForLineBreakingOnThisLine)
    1308             :         return FB_FOUND_VALID_TEXTRUN_BOUNDARY;
    1309             :     }
    1310           1 :     if (!aState->mFirstTextFrame) {
    1311           1 :       aState->mFirstTextFrame = textFrame;
    1312             :     }
    1313           1 :     aState->mLastTextFrame = textFrame;
    1314             :   }
    1315             : 
    1316           1 :   if (aFrame == aState->mStopAtFrame)
    1317             :     return FB_STOPPED_AT_STOP_FRAME;
    1318             : 
    1319           1 :   if (textFrame) {
    1320           1 :     if (!aState->mSeenSpaceForLineBreakingOnThisLine) {
    1321           1 :       const nsTextFragment* frag = textFrame->GetContent()->GetText();
    1322           1 :       uint32_t start = textFrame->GetContentOffset();
    1323             :       const void* text = frag->Is2b()
    1324           1 :           ? static_cast<const void*>(frag->Get2b() + start)
    1325           1 :           : static_cast<const void*>(frag->Get1b() + start);
    1326           1 :       if (TextContainsLineBreakerWhiteSpace(text, textFrame->GetContentLength(),
    1327           1 :                                             frag->Is2b())) {
    1328           1 :         aState->mSeenSpaceForLineBreakingOnThisLine = true;
    1329           1 :         if (aState->mSeenTextRunBoundaryOnLaterLine)
    1330             :           return FB_FOUND_VALID_TEXTRUN_BOUNDARY;
    1331             :       }
    1332             :     }
    1333             :     return FB_CONTINUE;
    1334             :   }
    1335             : 
    1336             :   FrameTextTraversal traversal =
    1337           1 :     CanTextCrossFrameBoundary(aFrame, frameType);
    1338           1 :   if (!traversal.mTextRunCanCrossFrameBoundary) {
    1339           1 :     aState->mSeenTextRunBoundaryOnThisLine = true;
    1340           1 :     if (aState->mSeenSpaceForLineBreakingOnThisLine)
    1341             :       return FB_FOUND_VALID_TEXTRUN_BOUNDARY;
    1342             :   }
    1343             : 
    1344           1 :   for (nsIFrame* f = traversal.NextFrameToScan(); f;
    1345             :        f = traversal.NextFrameToScan()) {
    1346           1 :     FindBoundaryResult result = FindBoundaries(f, aState);
    1347           1 :     if (result != FB_CONTINUE)
    1348           1 :       return result;
    1349             :   }
    1350             : 
    1351           1 :   if (!traversal.mTextRunCanCrossFrameBoundary) {
    1352           1 :     aState->mSeenTextRunBoundaryOnThisLine = true;
    1353           1 :     if (aState->mSeenSpaceForLineBreakingOnThisLine)
    1354             :       return FB_FOUND_VALID_TEXTRUN_BOUNDARY;
    1355             :   }
    1356             : 
    1357             :   return FB_CONTINUE;
    1358             : }
    1359             : 
    1360             : // build text runs for the 200 lines following aForFrame, and stop after that
    1361             : // when we get a chance.
    1362             : #define NUM_LINES_TO_BUILD_TEXT_RUNS 200
    1363             : 
    1364             : /**
    1365             :  * General routine for building text runs. This is hairy because of the need
    1366             :  * to build text runs that span content nodes.
    1367             :  *
    1368             :  * @param aContext The gfxContext we're using to construct this text run.
    1369             :  * @param aForFrame The nsTextFrame for which we're building this text run.
    1370             :  * @param aLineContainer the line container containing aForFrame; if null,
    1371             :  *        we'll walk the ancestors to find it.  It's required to be non-null
    1372             :  *        when aForFrameLine is non-null.
    1373             :  * @param aForFrameLine the line containing aForFrame; if null, we'll figure
    1374             :  *        out the line (slowly)
    1375             :  * @param aWhichTextRun The type of text run we want to build. If font inflation
    1376             :  *        is enabled, this will be eInflated, otherwise it's eNotInflated.
    1377             :  */
    1378             : static void
    1379           1 : BuildTextRuns(DrawTarget* aDrawTarget, nsTextFrame* aForFrame,
    1380             :               nsIFrame* aLineContainer,
    1381             :               const nsLineList::iterator* aForFrameLine,
    1382             :               nsTextFrame::TextRunType aWhichTextRun)
    1383             : {
    1384             :   MOZ_ASSERT(aForFrame, "for no frame?");
    1385             :   NS_ASSERTION(!aForFrameLine || aLineContainer,
    1386             :                "line but no line container");
    1387             : 
    1388           1 :   nsIFrame* lineContainerChild = aForFrame;
    1389           1 :   if (!aLineContainer) {
    1390           1 :     if (aForFrame->IsFloatingFirstLetterChild()) {
    1391           1 :       lineContainerChild = aForFrame->PresContext()->PresShell()->
    1392           1 :         GetPlaceholderFrameFor(aForFrame->GetParent());
    1393             :     }
    1394           1 :     aLineContainer = FindLineContainer(lineContainerChild);
    1395             :   } else {
    1396             :     NS_ASSERTION((aLineContainer == FindLineContainer(aForFrame) ||
    1397             :                   (aLineContainer->GetType() == nsGkAtoms::letterFrame &&
    1398             :                    aLineContainer->IsFloating())),
    1399             :                  "Wrong line container hint");
    1400             :   }
    1401             : 
    1402           1 :   if (aForFrame->HasAnyStateBits(TEXT_IS_IN_TOKEN_MATHML)) {
    1403             :     aLineContainer->AddStateBits(TEXT_IS_IN_TOKEN_MATHML);
    1404           1 :     if (aForFrame->HasAnyStateBits(NS_FRAME_IS_IN_SINGLE_CHAR_MI)) {
    1405             :       aLineContainer->AddStateBits(NS_FRAME_IS_IN_SINGLE_CHAR_MI);
    1406             :     }
    1407             :   }
    1408           1 :   if (aForFrame->HasAnyStateBits(NS_FRAME_MATHML_SCRIPT_DESCENDANT)) {
    1409             :     aLineContainer->AddStateBits(NS_FRAME_MATHML_SCRIPT_DESCENDANT);
    1410             :   }
    1411             : 
    1412           1 :   nsPresContext* presContext = aLineContainer->PresContext();
    1413             :   BuildTextRunsScanner scanner(presContext, aDrawTarget,
    1414           1 :                                aLineContainer, aWhichTextRun);
    1415             : 
    1416           1 :   nsBlockFrame* block = nsLayoutUtils::GetAsBlock(aLineContainer);
    1417             : 
    1418           1 :   if (!block) {
    1419           1 :     nsIFrame* textRunContainer = aLineContainer;
    1420           1 :     if (aLineContainer->GetType() == nsGkAtoms::rubyTextContainerFrame) {
    1421             :       textRunContainer = aForFrame;
    1422           1 :       while (textRunContainer &&
    1423           1 :              textRunContainer->GetType() != nsGkAtoms::rubyTextFrame) {
    1424           1 :         textRunContainer = textRunContainer->GetParent();
    1425             :       }
    1426             :       MOZ_ASSERT(textRunContainer &&
    1427             :                  textRunContainer->GetParent() == aLineContainer);
    1428             :     } else {
    1429             :       NS_ASSERTION(
    1430             :         !aLineContainer->GetPrevInFlow() && !aLineContainer->GetNextInFlow(),
    1431             :         "Breakable non-block line containers other than "
    1432             :         "ruby text container is not supported");
    1433             :     }
    1434             :     // Just loop through all the children of the linecontainer ... it's really
    1435             :     // just one line
    1436             :     scanner.SetAtStartOfLine();
    1437           1 :     scanner.SetCommonAncestorWithLastFrame(nullptr);
    1438           1 :     for (nsIFrame* child : textRunContainer->PrincipalChildList()) {
    1439           1 :       scanner.ScanFrame(child);
    1440             :     }
    1441             :     // Set mStartOfLine so FlushFrames knows its textrun ends a line
    1442             :     scanner.SetAtStartOfLine();
    1443           1 :     scanner.FlushFrames(true, false);
    1444           1 :     return;
    1445             :   }
    1446             : 
    1447             :   // Find the line containing 'lineContainerChild'.
    1448             : 
    1449           1 :   bool isValid = true;
    1450           1 :   nsBlockInFlowLineIterator backIterator(block, &isValid);
    1451           1 :   if (aForFrameLine) {
    1452           1 :     backIterator = nsBlockInFlowLineIterator(block, *aForFrameLine);
    1453             :   } else {
    1454           1 :     backIterator = nsBlockInFlowLineIterator(block, lineContainerChild, &isValid);
    1455             :     NS_ASSERTION(isValid, "aForFrame not found in block, someone lied to us");
    1456             :     NS_ASSERTION(backIterator.GetContainer() == block,
    1457             :                  "Someone lied to us about the block");
    1458             :   }
    1459           1 :   nsBlockFrame::LineIterator startLine = backIterator.GetLine();
    1460             : 
    1461             :   // Find a line where we can start building text runs. We choose the last line
    1462             :   // where:
    1463             :   // -- there is a textrun boundary between the start of the line and the
    1464             :   // start of aForFrame
    1465             :   // -- there is a space between the start of the line and the textrun boundary
    1466             :   // (this is so we can be sure the line breaks will be set properly
    1467             :   // on the textruns we construct).
    1468             :   // The possibly-partial text runs up to and including the first space
    1469             :   // are not reconstructed. We construct partial text runs for that text ---
    1470             :   // for the sake of simplifying the code and feeding the linebreaker ---
    1471             :   // but we discard them instead of assigning them to frames.
    1472             :   // This is a little awkward because we traverse lines in the reverse direction
    1473             :   // but we traverse the frames in each line in the forward direction.
    1474           1 :   nsBlockInFlowLineIterator forwardIterator = backIterator;
    1475           1 :   nsIFrame* stopAtFrame = lineContainerChild;
    1476           1 :   nsTextFrame* nextLineFirstTextFrame = nullptr;
    1477           1 :   bool seenTextRunBoundaryOnLaterLine = false;
    1478           1 :   bool mayBeginInTextRun = true;
    1479             :   while (true) {
    1480             :     forwardIterator = backIterator;
    1481           1 :     nsBlockFrame::LineIterator line = backIterator.GetLine();
    1482           1 :     if (!backIterator.Prev() || backIterator.GetLine()->IsBlock()) {
    1483             :       mayBeginInTextRun = false;
    1484           1 :       break;
    1485             :     }
    1486             : 
    1487             :     BuildTextRunsScanner::FindBoundaryState state = { stopAtFrame, nullptr, nullptr,
    1488           1 :       bool(seenTextRunBoundaryOnLaterLine), false, false };
    1489           1 :     nsIFrame* child = line->mFirstChild;
    1490           1 :     bool foundBoundary = false;
    1491           1 :     for (int32_t i = line->GetChildCount() - 1; i >= 0; --i) {
    1492             :       BuildTextRunsScanner::FindBoundaryResult result =
    1493           1 :           scanner.FindBoundaries(child, &state);
    1494           1 :       if (result == BuildTextRunsScanner::FB_FOUND_VALID_TEXTRUN_BOUNDARY) {
    1495             :         foundBoundary = true;
    1496             :         break;
    1497           1 :       } else if (result == BuildTextRunsScanner::FB_STOPPED_AT_STOP_FRAME) {
    1498             :         break;
    1499             :       }
    1500           1 :       child = child->GetNextSibling();
    1501             :     }
    1502           1 :     if (foundBoundary)
    1503             :       break;
    1504           1 :     if (!stopAtFrame && state.mLastTextFrame && nextLineFirstTextFrame &&
    1505           1 :         !scanner.ContinueTextRunAcrossFrames(state.mLastTextFrame, nextLineFirstTextFrame)) {
    1506             :       // Found a usable textrun boundary at the end of the line
    1507           1 :       if (state.mSeenSpaceForLineBreakingOnThisLine)
    1508             :         break;
    1509             :       seenTextRunBoundaryOnLaterLine = true;
    1510           1 :     } else if (state.mSeenTextRunBoundaryOnThisLine) {
    1511           1 :       seenTextRunBoundaryOnLaterLine = true;
    1512             :     }
    1513           1 :     stopAtFrame = nullptr;
    1514           1 :     if (state.mFirstTextFrame) {
    1515           1 :       nextLineFirstTextFrame = state.mFirstTextFrame;
    1516             :     }
    1517             :   }
    1518           1 :   scanner.SetSkipIncompleteTextRuns(mayBeginInTextRun);
    1519             : 
    1520             :   // Now iterate over all text frames starting from the current line. First-in-flow
    1521             :   // text frames will be accumulated into textRunFrames as we go. When a
    1522             :   // text run boundary is required we flush textRunFrames ((re)building their
    1523             :   // gfxTextRuns as necessary).
    1524           1 :   bool seenStartLine = false;
    1525           1 :   uint32_t linesAfterStartLine = 0;
    1526           1 :   do {
    1527           1 :     nsBlockFrame::LineIterator line = forwardIterator.GetLine();
    1528           1 :     if (line->IsBlock())
    1529             :       break;
    1530           1 :     line->SetInvalidateTextRuns(false);
    1531             :     scanner.SetAtStartOfLine();
    1532           1 :     scanner.SetCommonAncestorWithLastFrame(nullptr);
    1533           1 :     nsIFrame* child = line->mFirstChild;
    1534           1 :     for (int32_t i = line->GetChildCount() - 1; i >= 0; --i) {
    1535           1 :       scanner.ScanFrame(child);
    1536           1 :       child = child->GetNextSibling();
    1537             :     }
    1538           1 :     if (line.get() == startLine.get()) {
    1539           1 :       seenStartLine = true;
    1540             :     }
    1541           1 :     if (seenStartLine) {
    1542           1 :       ++linesAfterStartLine;
    1543           1 :       if (linesAfterStartLine >= NUM_LINES_TO_BUILD_TEXT_RUNS && scanner.CanStopOnThisLine()) {
    1544             :         // Don't flush frames; we may be in the middle of a textrun
    1545             :         // that we can't end here. That's OK, we just won't build it.
    1546             :         // Note that we must already have finished the textrun for aForFrame,
    1547             :         // because we've seen the end of a textrun in a line after the line
    1548             :         // containing aForFrame.
    1549           1 :         scanner.FlushLineBreaks(nullptr);
    1550             :         // This flushes out mMappedFlows and mLineBreakBeforeFrames, which
    1551             :         // silences assertions in the scanner destructor.
    1552           1 :         scanner.ResetRunInfo();
    1553             :         return;
    1554             :       }
    1555             :     }
    1556             :   } while (forwardIterator.Next());
    1557             : 
    1558             :   // Set mStartOfLine so FlushFrames knows its textrun ends a line
    1559             :   scanner.SetAtStartOfLine();
    1560           1 :   scanner.FlushFrames(true, false);
    1561             : }
    1562             : 
    1563             : static char16_t*

    1569           1 :     ++aSrc;
    1570           1 :     --aCount;
    1571             :   }
    1572           1 :   return aDest;

    1602             : {
    1603             :   RefPtr<gfxTextRun> textRun;

    1612           1 :       textRun = mCurrentFramesAllSameTextRun;

    1646           1 : void BuildTextRunsScanner::FlushLineBreaks(gfxTextRun* aTrailingTextRun)

    1648             :   bool trailingLineBreak;

    1726             : static nscoord

    1742             : 
    1743             : // This function converts non-coord values (e.g. percentages) to nscoord.

    1762             : 
    1763             : // Returns gfxTextRunFactory::TEXT_ENABLE_SPACING if non-standard
    1764             : // letter-spacing or word-spacing is present.
    1765             : static uint32_t
    1766           1 : GetSpacingFlags(nsIFrame* aFrame, const nsStyleText* aStyleText = nullptr)
    1767             : {
    1768           1 :   if (nsSVGUtils::IsInSVGTextSubtree(aFrame)) {
    1769             :     return 0;
    1770             :   }
    1771             : 
    1772           1 :   const nsStyleText* styleText = aFrame->StyleText();
    1773           1 :   const nsStyleCoord& ls = styleText->mLetterSpacing;
    1774           1 :   const nsStyleCoord& ws = styleText->mWordSpacing;
    1775             : 
    1776             :   // It's possible to have a calc() value that computes to zero but for which
    1777             :   // IsDefinitelyZero() is false, in which case we'll return
    1778             :   // TEXT_ENABLE_SPACING unnecessarily. That's ok because such cases are likely
    1779             :   // to be rare, and avoiding TEXT_ENABLE_SPACING is just an optimization.
    1780             :   bool nonStandardSpacing =
    1781           1 :     (eStyleUnit_Coord == ls.GetUnit() && ls.GetCoordValue() != 0) ||
    1782           1 :     (eStyleUnit_Coord == ws.GetUnit() && ws.GetCoordValue() != 0) ||
    1783           1 :     (eStyleUnit_Percent == ws.GetUnit() && ws.GetPercentValue() != 0) ||
    1784           1 :     (eStyleUnit_Calc == ws.GetUnit() && !ws.GetCalcValue()->IsDefinitelyZero());
    1785             : 
    1786           1 :   return nonStandardSpacing ? gfxTextRunFactory::TEXT_ENABLE_SPACING : 0;
    1787             : }
    1788             : 
    1789             : bool
    1790           1 : BuildTextRunsScanner::ContinueTextRunAcrossFrames(nsTextFrame* aFrame1, nsTextFrame* aFrame2)
    1791             : {
    1792             :   // We don't need to check font size inflation, since
    1793             :   // |FindLineContainer| above (via |nsIFrame::CanContinueTextRun|)
    1794             :   // ensures that text runs never cross block boundaries.  This means
    1795             :   // that the font size inflation on all text frames in the text run is
    1796             :   // already guaranteed to be the same as each other (and for the line
    1797             :   // container).
    1798           1 :   if (mBidiEnabled) {
    1799           1 :     FrameBidiData data1 = aFrame1->GetBidiData();
    1800           1 :     FrameBidiData data2 = aFrame2->GetBidiData();
    1801           1 :     if (data1.embeddingLevel != data2.embeddingLevel ||
    1802           1 :         data2.precedingControl != kBidiLevelNone) {
    1803           1 :       return false;
    1804             :     }
    1805             :   }
    1806             : 
    1807           1 :   nsStyleContext* sc1 = aFrame1->StyleContext();
    1808           1 :   const nsStyleText* textStyle1 = sc1->StyleText();
    1809             :   // If the first frame ends in a preformatted newline, then we end the textrun
    1810             :   // here. This avoids creating giant textruns for an entire plain text file.
    1811             :   // Note that we create a single text frame for a preformatted text node,
    1812             :   // even if it has newlines in it, so typically we won't see trailing newlines
    1813             :   // until after reflow has broken up the frame into one (or more) frames per
    1814             :   // line. That's OK though.
    1815           1 :   if (textStyle1->NewlineIsSignificant(aFrame1) && HasTerminalNewline(aFrame1))
    1816             :     return false;
    1817             : 
    1818           1 :   if (aFrame1->GetContent() == aFrame2->GetContent() &&
    1819           1 :       aFrame1->GetNextInFlow() != aFrame2) {
    1820             :     // aFrame2 must be a non-fluid continuation of aFrame1. This can happen
    1821             :     // sometimes when the unicode-bidi property is used; the bidi resolver
    1822             :     // breaks text into different frames even though the text has the same
    1823             :     // direction. We can't allow these two frames to share the same textrun
    1824             :     // because that would violate our invariant that two flows in the same
    1825             :     // textrun have different content elements.
    1826             :     return false;
    1827             :   }
    1828             : 
    1829           1 :   nsStyleContext* sc2 = aFrame2->StyleContext();
    1830           1 :   const nsStyleText* textStyle2 = sc2->StyleText();
    1831           1 :   if (sc1 == sc2)
    1832             :     return true;
    1833             : 
    1834           1 :   const nsStyleFont* fontStyle1 = sc1->StyleFont();
    1835           1 :   const nsStyleFont* fontStyle2 = sc2->StyleFont();
    1836           1 :   nscoord letterSpacing1 = LetterSpacing(aFrame1);
    1837           1 :   nscoord letterSpacing2 = LetterSpacing(aFrame2);
    1838           1 :   return fontStyle1->mFont == fontStyle2->mFont &&
    1839           1 :     fontStyle1->mLanguage == fontStyle2->mLanguage &&
    1840           1 :     textStyle1->mTextTransform == textStyle2->mTextTransform &&
    1841           1 :     nsLayoutUtils::GetTextRunFlagsForStyle(sc1, fontStyle1, textStyle1, letterSpacing1) ==
    1842           1 :       nsLayoutUtils::GetTextRunFlagsForStyle(sc2, fontStyle2, textStyle2, letterSpacing2);
    1843             : }
    1844             : 
    1845           1 : void BuildTextRunsScanner::ScanFrame(nsIFrame* aFrame)
    1846             : {
    1847           1 :   nsIAtom* frameType = aFrame->GetType();
    1848           1 :   if (frameType == nsGkAtoms::rubyTextContainerFrame) {
    1849             :     // Don't include any ruby text container into the text run.
    1850           1 :     return;
    1851             :   }
    1852             : 
    1853             :   // First check if we can extend the current mapped frame block. This is common.
    1854           1 :   if (mMappedFlows.Length() > 0) {
    1855           1 :     MappedFlow* mappedFlow = &mMappedFlows[mMappedFlows.Length() - 1];
    1856           1 :     if (mappedFlow->mEndFrame == aFrame &&
    1857           1 :         (aFrame->GetStateBits() & NS_FRAME_IS_FLUID_CONTINUATION)) {
    1858             :       NS_ASSERTION(frameType == nsGkAtoms::textFrame,
    1859             :                    "Flow-sibling of a text frame is not a text frame?");
    1860             : 
    1861             :       // Don't do this optimization if mLastFrame has a terminal newline...
    1862             :       // it's quite likely preformatted and we might want to end the textrun here.
    1863             :       // This is almost always true:
    1864           1 :       if (mLastFrame->StyleContext() == aFrame->StyleContext() &&
    1865           1 :           !HasTerminalNewline(mLastFrame)) {
    1866           1 :         AccumulateRunInfo(static_cast<nsTextFrame*>(aFrame));
    1867           1 :         return;
    1868             :       }
    1869             :     }
    1870             :   }
    1871             : 
    1872             :   // Now see if we can add a new set of frames to the current textrun
    1873           1 :   if (frameType == nsGkAtoms::textFrame) {
    1874           1 :     nsTextFrame* frame = static_cast<nsTextFrame*>(aFrame);
    1875             : 
    1876           1 :     if (mLastFrame) {
    1877           1 :       if (!ContinueTextRunAcrossFrames(mLastFrame, frame)) {
    1878           1 :         FlushFrames(false, false);
    1879             :       } else {

    2000             :   {

    2006             :     nsTextFrameUtils::COMPRESS_NONE_TRANSFORM_TO_SPACE // -moz-pre-space
    2007             :   };

    2011           1 :       !aStyleText->NewlineIsSignificant(aFrame)) {

    2013             :     // transform newline to space.

    2015             :   }
    2016           1 :   return compression;
    2017             : }

    2631             : static bool
    2632           0 : MayCharacterHaveEmphasisMark(uint32_t aCh)

    2641             :                 "we need to explicitly do the comparison below");

    2643           0 :            (category >= HB_UNICODE_GENERAL_CATEGORY_LINE_SEPARATOR &&
    2644           0 :             category <= HB_UNICODE_GENERAL_CATEGORY_SPACE_SEPARATOR));

    2647             : static bool
    2648           0 : MayCharacterHaveEmphasisMark(uint8_t aCh)

    2689             : 
    2690             : // Find the flow corresponding to aContent in aUserData
    2691             : static inline TextRunMappedFlow*
    2692           1 : FindFlowForContent(TextRunUserData* aUserData, nsIContent* aContent,
    2693             :                    TextRunMappedFlow* userMappedFlows)
    2694             : {
    2695             :   // Find the flow that contains us
    2696           1 :   int32_t i = aUserData->mLastFlowIndex;
    2697           1 :   int32_t delta = 1;
    2698           1 :   int32_t sign = 1;
    2699             :   // Search starting at the current position and examine close-by
    2700             :   // positions first, moving further and further away as we go.
    2701           1 :   while (i >= 0 && uint32_t(i) < aUserData->mMappedFlowCount) {
    2702           1 :     TextRunMappedFlow* flow = &userMappedFlows[i];
    2703           1 :     if (flow->mStartFrame->GetContent() == aContent) {
    2704           1 :       return flow;
    2705             :     }
    2706             : 
    2707           1 :     i += delta;
    2708           1 :     sign = -sign;
    2709           1 :     delta = -delta + sign;
    2710             :   }
    2711             : 
    2712             :   // We ran into an array edge.  Add |delta| to |i| once more to get
    2713             :   // back to the side where we still need to search, then step in
    2714             :   // the |sign| direction.
    2715           1 :   i += delta;
    2716           1 :   if (sign > 0) {
    2717           1 :     for (; i < int32_t(aUserData->mMappedFlowCount); ++i) {
    2718           1 :       TextRunMappedFlow* flow = &userMappedFlows[i];
    2719           1 :       if (flow->mStartFrame->GetContent() == aContent) {
    2720           1 :         return flow;
    2721             :       }
    2722             :     }
    2723             :   } else {
    2724           1 :     for (; i >= 0; --i) {
    2725           1 :       TextRunMappedFlow* flow = &userMappedFlows[i];
    2726           1 :       if (flow->mStartFrame->GetContent() == aContent) {
    2727           1 :         return flow;
    2728             :       }
    2729             :     }
    2730             :   }
    2731             : 
    2732             :   return nullptr;
    2733             : }
    2734             : 
    2735             : void
    2736           1 : BuildTextRunsScanner::AssignTextRun(gfxTextRun* aTextRun, float aInflation)
    2737             : {
    2738           1 :   for (uint32_t i = 0; i < mMappedFlows.Length(); ++i) {
    2739           1 :     MappedFlow* mappedFlow = &mMappedFlows[i];
    2740           1 :     nsTextFrame* startFrame = mappedFlow->mStartFrame;
    2741           1 :     nsTextFrame* endFrame = mappedFlow->mEndFrame;
    2742             :     nsTextFrame* f;
    2743           1 :     for (f = startFrame; f != endFrame; f = f->GetNextContinuation()) {
    2744             : #ifdef DEBUG_roc
    2745             :       if (f->GetTextRun(mWhichTextRun)) {
    2746             :         gfxTextRun* textRun = f->GetTextRun(mWhichTextRun);
    2747             :         if (textRun->GetFlags() & nsTextFrameUtils::TEXT_IS_SIMPLE_FLOW) {
    2748             :           if (mMappedFlows[0].mStartFrame != GetFrameForSimpleFlow(textRun)) {
    2749             :             NS_WARNING("REASSIGNING SIMPLE FLOW TEXT RUN!");
    2750             :           }
    2751             :         } else {
    2752             :           auto userData = static_cast<TextRunUserData*>(aTextRun->GetUserData());
    2753             :           TextRunMappedFlow* userMappedFlows = GetMappedFlows(aTextRun);
    2754             :           if (userData->mMappedFlowCount >= mMappedFlows.Length() ||
    2755             :               userMappedFlows[userData->mMappedFlowCount - 1].mStartFrame !=

    2758             :           }
    2759             :         }
    2760             :       }
    2761             : #endif
    2762             : 
    2763           1 :       gfxTextRun* oldTextRun = f->GetTextRun(mWhichTextRun);

    2943           1 : static bool IsJustifiableCharacter(const nsStyleText* aTextStyle,
    2944             :                                    const nsTextFragment* aFrag, int32_t aPos,
    2945             :                                    bool aLangIsCJ)
    2946             : {
    2947             :   NS_ASSERTION(aPos >= 0, "negative position?!");
    2948             : 
    2949           1 :   StyleTextJustify justifyStyle = aTextStyle->mTextJustify;
    2950           1 :   if (justifyStyle == StyleTextJustify::None) {
    2951             :     return false;
    2952             :   }
    2953             : 
    2954           1 :   char16_t ch = aFrag->CharAt(aPos);
    2955           1 :   if (ch == '\n' || ch == '\t' || ch == '\r') {
    2956             :     return true;
    2957             :   }
    2958           1 :   if (ch == ' ' || ch == CH_NBSP) {
    2959             :     // Don't justify spaces that are combined with diacriticals
    2960           1 :     if (!aFrag->Is2b()) {
    2961             :       return true;
    2962             :     }
    2963             :     return !nsTextFrameUtils::IsSpaceCombiningSequenceTail(
    2964           1 :       aFrag->Get2b() + aPos + 1, aFrag->GetLength() - (aPos + 1));
    2965             :   }
    2966             : 
    2967           1 :   if (justifyStyle == StyleTextJustify::InterCharacter) {
    2968             :     return true;
    2969           1 :   } else if (justifyStyle == StyleTextJustify::InterWord) {
    2970             :     return false;
    2971             :   }
    2972             : 
    2973             :   // text-justify: auto
    2974           1 :   if (ch < 0x2150u) {
    2975             :     return false;
    2976             :   }
    2977           1 :   if (aLangIsCJ) {
    2978           0 :     if ((0x2150u <= ch && ch <= 0x22ffu) || // Number Forms, Arrows, Mathematical Operators
    2979           0 :         (0x2460u <= ch && ch <= 0x24ffu) || // Enclosed Alphanumerics
    2980           0 :         (0x2580u <= ch && ch <= 0x27bfu) || // Block Elements, Geometric Shapes, Miscellaneous Symbols, Dingbats
    2981           0 :         (0x27f0u <= ch && ch <= 0x2bffu) || // Supplemental Arrows-A, Braille Patterns, Supplemental Arrows-B,
    2982             :                                             // Miscellaneous Mathematical Symbols-B, Supplemental Mathematical Operators,
    2983             :                                             // Miscellaneous Symbols and Arrows
    2984           0 :         (0x2e80u <= ch && ch <= 0x312fu) || // CJK Radicals Supplement, CJK Radicals Supplement,
    2985             :                                             // Ideographic Description Characters, CJK Symbols and Punctuation,
    2986             :                                             // Hiragana, Katakana, Bopomofo
    2987           0 :         (0x3190u <= ch && ch <= 0xabffu) || // Kanbun, Bopomofo Extended, Katakana Phonetic Extensions,
    2988             :                                             // Enclosed CJK Letters and Months, CJK Compatibility,
    2989             :                                             // CJK Unified Ideographs Extension A, Yijing Hexagram Symbols,
    2990             :                                             // CJK Unified Ideographs, Yi Syllables, Yi Radicals
    2991           0 :         (0xf900u <= ch && ch <= 0xfaffu) || // CJK Compatibility Ideographs
    2992           0 :         (0xff5eu <= ch && ch <= 0xff9fu)    // Halfwidth and Fullwidth Forms(a part)
    2993             :        ) {
    2994             :       return true;
    2995             :     }
    2996             :     char16_t ch2;
    2997           0 :     if (NS_IS_HIGH_SURROGATE(ch) && aFrag->GetLength() > uint32_t(aPos) + 1 &&

    2999           0 :       uint32_t u = SURROGATE_TO_UCS4(ch, ch2);

    3001             :                                             // CJK Unified Ideographs Extension C,
    3002             :                                             // CJK Unified Ideographs Extension D,
    3003             :                                             // CJK Compatibility Ideographs Supplement
    3004             :         return true;
    3005             :       }
    3006             :     }
    3007             :   }
    3008           1 :   return false;
    3009             : }

    3021           1 : static int32_t FindChar(const nsTextFragment* frag,
    3022             :                         int32_t aOffset, int32_t aLength, char16_t ch)
    3023             : {
    3024           1 :   int32_t i = 0;

    3026           1 :     const char16_t* str = frag->Get2b() + aOffset;
    3027           1 :     for (; i < aLength; ++i) {
    3028           1 :       if (*str == ch)
    3029           1 :         return i + aOffset;
    3030           1 :       ++str;
    3031             :     }
    3032             :   } else {
    3033           1 :     if (uint16_t(ch) <= 0xFF) {
    3034           1 :       const char* str = frag->Get1b() + aOffset;
    3035           1 :       const void* p = memchr(str, ch, aLength);
    3036           1 :       if (p)
    3037           1 :         return (static_cast<const char*>(p) - str) + aOffset;
    3038             :     }
    3039             :   }
