    3208             :   gfxSkipCharsIterator            mStart;  // Offset in original and transformed string
    3209             :   const gfxSkipCharsIterator      mTempIterator;
    3210             : 
    3211             :   // Either null, or pointing to the frame's TabWidthProperty.
    3212             :   mutable TabWidthStore*          mTabWidths;
    3213             :   // How far we've done tab-width calculation; this is ONLY valid when
    3214             :   // mTabWidths is nullptr (otherwise rely on mTabWidths->mLimit instead).
    3215             :   // It's a DOM offset relative to the current frame's offset.
    3216             :   mutable uint32_t                mTabWidthsAnalyzedLimit;
    3217             : 
    3218             :   int32_t                         mLength;  // DOM string length, may be INT32_MAX
    3219             :   const gfxFloat                  mWordSpacing; // space for each whitespace char
    3220             :   const gfxFloat                  mLetterSpacing; // space for each letter
    3221             :   mutable gfxFloat                mHyphenWidth;
    3222             :   mutable gfxFloat                mOffsetFromBlockOriginForTabs;
    3223             : 
    3224             :   // The values in mJustificationSpacings corresponds to unskipped
    3225             :   // characters start from mJustificationArrayStart.
    3226             :   uint32_t                        mJustificationArrayStart;
    3227             :   nsTArray<Spacing>               mJustificationSpacings;
    3228             : 
    3229             :   const bool                      mReflowing;
    3230             :   const nsTextFrame::TextRunType  mWhichTextRun;
    3231             : };
    3232             : 
    3233             : /**
    3234             :  * Finds the offset of the first character of the cluster containing aPos
    3235             :  */
    3236           1 : static void FindClusterStart(const gfxTextRun* aTextRun,
    3237             :                              int32_t aOriginalStart,
    3238             :                              gfxSkipCharsIterator* aPos)
    3239             : {
    3240           1 :   while (aPos->GetOriginalOffset() > aOriginalStart) {
    3241           1 :     if (aPos->IsOriginalCharSkipped() ||
    3242           1 :         aTextRun->IsClusterStart(aPos->GetSkippedOffset())) {
    3243             :       break;
    3244             :     }
    3245           0 :     aPos->AdvanceOriginal(-1);
    3246             :   }
    3247           1 : }
    3248             : 
    3249             : /**
    3250             :  * Finds the offset of the last character of the cluster containing aPos.
    3251             :  * If aAllowSplitLigature is false, we also check for a ligature-group
    3252             :  * start.
    3253             :  */
    3254           1 : static void FindClusterEnd(const gfxTextRun* aTextRun,
    3255             :                            int32_t aOriginalEnd,
    3256             :                            gfxSkipCharsIterator* aPos,
    3257             :                            bool aAllowSplitLigature = true)
    3258             : {
    3259             :   NS_PRECONDITION(aPos->GetOriginalOffset() < aOriginalEnd,
    3260             :                   "character outside string");
    3261           1 :   aPos->AdvanceOriginal(1);
    3262           1 :   while (aPos->GetOriginalOffset() < aOriginalEnd) {
    3263           1 :     if (aPos->IsOriginalCharSkipped() ||
    3264           1 :         (aTextRun->IsClusterStart(aPos->GetSkippedOffset()) &&
    3265           0 :          (aAllowSplitLigature ||
    3266           0 :           aTextRun->IsLigatureGroupStart(aPos->GetSkippedOffset())))) {
    3267             :       break;
    3268             :     }
    3269           0 :     aPos->AdvanceOriginal(1);
    3270             :   }
    3271           1 :   aPos->AdvanceOriginal(-1);
    3272           1 : }
    3273             : 
    3274             : JustificationInfo
    3275           1 : PropertyProvider::ComputeJustification(
    3276             :   Range aRange, nsTArray<JustificationAssignment>* aAssignments)
    3277             : {
    3278           1 :   JustificationInfo info;
    3279             : 
    3280             :   // Horizontal-in-vertical frame is orthogonal to the line, so it
    3281             :   // doesn't actually include any justification opportunity inside.
    3282             :   // The spec says such frame should be treated as a U+FFFC. Since we
    3283             :   // do not insert justification opportunities on the sides of that
    3284             :   // character, the sides of this frame are not justifiable either.
    3285           1 :   if (mFrame->StyleContext()->IsTextCombined()) {
    3286           0 :     return info;
    3287             :   }
    3288             : 
    3289           1 :   bool isCJ = IsChineseOrJapanese(mFrame);
    3290             :   nsSkipCharsRunIterator run(
    3291           1 :     mStart, nsSkipCharsRunIterator::LENGTH_INCLUDES_SKIPPED, aRange.Length());
    3292           1 :   run.SetOriginalOffset(aRange.start);
    3293           1 :   mJustificationArrayStart = run.GetSkippedOffset();
    3294             : 
    3295             :   nsTArray<JustificationAssignment> assignments;
    3296           1 :   assignments.SetCapacity(aRange.Length());
    3297           1 :   while (run.NextRun()) {
    3298           1 :     uint32_t originalOffset = run.GetOriginalOffset();
    3299           1 :     uint32_t skippedOffset = run.GetSkippedOffset();
    3300           1 :     uint32_t length = run.GetRunLength();
    3301           1 :     assignments.SetLength(skippedOffset + length - mJustificationArrayStart);
    3302             : 
    3303           1 :     gfxSkipCharsIterator iter = run.GetPos();
    3304           1 :     for (uint32_t i = 0; i < length; ++i) {
    3305           1 :       uint32_t offset = originalOffset + i;
    3306           1 :       if (!IsJustifiableCharacter(mTextStyle, mFrag, offset, isCJ)) {
    3307             :         continue;
    3308             :       }
    3309             : 
    3310           1 :       iter.SetOriginalOffset(offset);
    3311             : 
    3312           1 :       FindClusterStart(mTextRun, originalOffset, &iter);
    3313           1 :       uint32_t firstCharOffset = iter.GetSkippedOffset();
    3314           1 :       uint32_t firstChar = firstCharOffset > mJustificationArrayStart ?
    3315           1 :         firstCharOffset - mJustificationArrayStart : 0;
    3316           1 :       if (!firstChar) {
    3317             :         info.mIsStartJustifiable = true;
    3318             :       } else {
    3319           1 :         auto& assign = assignments[firstChar];
    3320           1 :         auto& prevAssign = assignments[firstChar - 1];
    3321           1 :         if (prevAssign.mGapsAtEnd) {
    3322           1 :           prevAssign.mGapsAtEnd = 1;
    3323           1 :           assign.mGapsAtStart = 1;
    3324             :         } else {
    3325           1 :           assign.mGapsAtStart = 2;
    3326           1 :           info.mInnerOpportunities++;
    3327             :         }
    3328             :       }
    3329             : 
    3330           1 :       FindClusterEnd(mTextRun, originalOffset + length, &iter);
    3331           1 :       uint32_t lastChar = iter.GetSkippedOffset() - mJustificationArrayStart;
    3332             :       // Assign the two gaps temporary to the last char. If the next cluster is
    3333             :       // justifiable as well, one of the gaps will be removed by code above.
    3334           1 :       assignments[lastChar].mGapsAtEnd = 2;
    3335           1 :       info.mInnerOpportunities++;
    3336             : 
    3337             :       // Skip the whole cluster
    3338           1 :       i = iter.GetOriginalOffset() - originalOffset;
    3339             :     }
    3340             :   }
    3341             : 
    3342           1 :   if (!assignments.IsEmpty() && assignments.LastElement().mGapsAtEnd) {
    3343             :     // We counted the expansion opportunity after the last character,
    3344             :     // but it is not an inner opportunity.
    3345             :     MOZ_ASSERT(info.mInnerOpportunities > 0);
    3346           1 :     info.mInnerOpportunities--;
    3347           1 :     info.mIsEndJustifiable = true;
    3348             :   }
    3349             : 
    3350           1 :   if (aAssignments) {
    3351           1 :     *aAssignments = Move(assignments);
    3352             :   }
    3353           1 :   return info;
    3354             : }
    3355             : 
    3356             : // aStart, aLength in transformed string offsets
    3357             : void
    3358           1 : PropertyProvider::GetSpacing(Range aRange, Spacing* aSpacing) const
    3359             : {
    3360             :   GetSpacingInternal(aRange, aSpacing,
    3361           1 :                      (mTextRun->GetFlags() & nsTextFrameUtils::TEXT_HAS_TAB) == 0);
    3362           1 : }
    3363             : 
    3364             : static bool
    3365           1 : CanAddSpacingAfter(const gfxTextRun* aTextRun, uint32_t aOffset)
    3366             : {
    3367           1 :   if (aOffset + 1 >= aTextRun->GetLength())
    3368             :     return true;
    3369           1 :   return aTextRun->IsClusterStart(aOffset + 1) &&
    3370           1 :     aTextRun->IsLigatureGroupStart(aOffset + 1);
    3371             : }
    3372             : 
    3373             : static gfxFloat
    3374           1 : ComputeTabWidthAppUnits(const nsIFrame* aFrame, gfxTextRun* aTextRun)
    3375             : {
    3376           1 :   const nsStyleText* textStyle = aFrame->StyleText();
    3377           1 :   if (textStyle->mTabSize.GetUnit() != eStyleUnit_Factor) {
    3378           0 :     nscoord w = textStyle->mTabSize.GetCoordValue();
    3379             :     MOZ_ASSERT(w >= 0);
    3380           0 :     return w;
    3381             :   }
    3382             : 
    3383           1 :   gfxFloat spaces = textStyle->mTabSize.GetFactorValue();
    3384             :   MOZ_ASSERT(spaces >= 0);
    3385             : 
    3386             :   // Round the space width when converting to appunits the same way
    3387             :   // textruns do.
    3388             :   gfxFloat spaceWidthAppUnits =
    3389             :     NS_round(GetFirstFontMetrics(aTextRun->GetFontGroup(),
    3390           1 :                                  aTextRun->IsVertical()).spaceWidth *
    3391           1 :              aTextRun->GetAppUnitsPerDevUnit());
    3392           1 :   return spaces * spaceWidthAppUnits;
    3393             : }
    3394             : 
    3395             : void
    3396           1 : PropertyProvider::GetSpacingInternal(Range aRange, Spacing* aSpacing,
    3397             :                                      bool aIgnoreTabs) const
    3398             : {
    3399             :   NS_PRECONDITION(IsInBounds(mStart, mLength, aRange), "Range out of bounds");
    3400             : 
    3401             :   uint32_t index;
    3402           1 :   for (index = 0; index < aRange.Length(); ++index) {
    3403           1 :     aSpacing[index].mBefore = 0.0;
    3404           1 :     aSpacing[index].mAfter = 0.0;
    3405             :   }
    3406             : 
    3407           1 :   if (mFrame->StyleContext()->IsTextCombined()) {
    3408           0 :     return;
    3409             :   }
    3410             : 
    3411             :   // Find our offset into the original+transformed string
    3412           1 :   gfxSkipCharsIterator start(mStart);
    3413           1 :   start.SetSkippedOffset(aRange.start);
    3414             : 
    3415             :   // First, compute the word and letter spacing
    3416           1 :   if (mWordSpacing || mLetterSpacing) {
    3417             :     // Iterate over non-skipped characters
    3418             :     nsSkipCharsRunIterator run(
    3419           1 :         start, nsSkipCharsRunIterator::LENGTH_UNSKIPPED_ONLY, aRange.Length());
    3420           1 :     while (run.NextRun()) {
    3421           1 :       uint32_t runOffsetInSubstring = run.GetSkippedOffset() - aRange.start;
    3422           1 :       gfxSkipCharsIterator iter = run.GetPos();
    3423           1 :       for (int32_t i = 0; i < run.GetRunLength(); ++i) {
    3424           1 :         if (CanAddSpacingAfter(mTextRun, run.GetSkippedOffset() + i)) {
    3425             :           // End of a cluster, not in a ligature: put letter-spacing after it
    3426           1 :           aSpacing[runOffsetInSubstring + i].mAfter += mLetterSpacing;
    3427             :         }
    3428           1 :         if (IsCSSWordSpacingSpace(mFrag, i + run.GetOriginalOffset(),
    3429           1 :                                   mFrame, mTextStyle)) {
    3430             :           // It kinda sucks, but space characters can be part of clusters,
    3431             :           // and even still be whitespace (I think!)
    3432           1 :           iter.SetSkippedOffset(run.GetSkippedOffset() + i);
    3433           1 :           FindClusterEnd(mTextRun, run.GetOriginalOffset() + run.GetRunLength(),
    3434           1 :                          &iter);
    3435           1 :           uint32_t runOffset = iter.GetSkippedOffset() - aRange.start;
    3436           1 :           aSpacing[runOffset].mAfter += mWordSpacing;
    3437             :         }
    3438             :       }
    3439             :     }
    3440             :   }
    3441             : 
    3442             :   // Now add tab spacing, if there is any
    3443           1 :   if (!aIgnoreTabs) {
    3444           1 :     gfxFloat tabWidth = ComputeTabWidthAppUnits(mFrame, mTextRun);
    3445           1 :     if (tabWidth > 0) {
    3446           1 :       CalcTabWidths(aRange, tabWidth);
    3447           1 :       if (mTabWidths) {
    3448             :         mTabWidths->ApplySpacing(aSpacing,
    3449           1 :                                  aRange.start - mStart.GetSkippedOffset(),
    3450           1 :                                  aRange.Length());
    3451             :       }
    3452             :     }
    3453             :   }
    3454             : 
    3455             :   // Now add in justification spacing
    3456           1 :   if (mJustificationSpacings.Length() > 0) {
    3457             :     // If there is any spaces trimmed at the end, aStart + aLength may
    3458             :     // be larger than the flags array. When that happens, we can simply
    3459             :     // ignore those spaces.
    3460           1 :     auto arrayEnd = mJustificationArrayStart +
    3461           1 :       static_cast<uint32_t>(mJustificationSpacings.Length());
    3462           1 :     auto end = std::min(aRange.end, arrayEnd);
    3463             :     MOZ_ASSERT(aRange.start >= mJustificationArrayStart);
    3464           1 :     for (auto i = aRange.start; i < end; i++) {
    3465             :       const auto& spacing =
    3466           1 :         mJustificationSpacings[i - mJustificationArrayStart];
    3467           1 :       uint32_t offset = i - aRange.start;
    3468           1 :       aSpacing[offset].mBefore += spacing.mBefore;
    3469           1 :       aSpacing[offset].mAfter += spacing.mAfter;
    3470             :     }
    3471             :   }
    3472             : }
    3473             : 
    3474             : // aX and the result are in whole appunits.
    3475             : static gfxFloat
    3476           1 : AdvanceToNextTab(gfxFloat aX, gfxFloat aTabWidth)
    3477             : {
    3478             : 
    3479             :   // Advance aX to the next multiple of *aCachedTabWidth. We must advance
    3480             :   // by at least 1 appunit.
    3481             :   // XXX should we make this 1 CSS pixel?
    3482           1 :   return ceil((aX + 1) / aTabWidth) * aTabWidth;
    3483             : }
    3484             : 
    3485             : void
    3486           1 : PropertyProvider::CalcTabWidths(Range aRange, gfxFloat aTabWidth) const
    3487             : {
    3488             :   MOZ_ASSERT(aTabWidth > 0);
    3489             : 
    3490           1 :   if (!mTabWidths) {
    3491           1 :     if (mReflowing && !mLineContainer) {
    3492             :       // Intrinsic width computation does its own tab processing. We
    3493             :       // just don't do anything here.
    3494             :       return;
    3495             :     }
    3496           1 :     if (!mReflowing) {
    3497           1 :       mTabWidths = mFrame->Properties().Get(TabWidthProperty());
    3498             : #ifdef DEBUG
    3499             :       // If we're not reflowing, we should have already computed the
    3500             :       // tab widths; check that they're available as far as the last
    3501             :       // tab character present (if any)
    3502             :       for (uint32_t i = aRange.end; i > aRange.start; --i) {
    3503             :         if (mTextRun->CharIsTab(i - 1)) {
    3504             :           uint32_t startOffset = mStart.GetSkippedOffset();
    3505             :           NS_ASSERTION(mTabWidths && mTabWidths->mLimit + startOffset >= i,
    3506             :                        "Precomputed tab widths are missing!");
    3507             :           break;
    3508             :         }
    3509             :       }
    3510             : #endif
    3511           1 :       return;
    3512             :     }
    3513             :   }
    3514             : 
    3515           1 :   uint32_t startOffset = mStart.GetSkippedOffset();
    3516             :   MOZ_ASSERT(aRange.start >= startOffset, "wrong start offset");
    3517             :   MOZ_ASSERT(aRange.end <= startOffset + mLength, "beyond the end");
    3518             :   uint32_t tabsEnd =
    3519           1 :     (mTabWidths ? mTabWidths->mLimit : mTabWidthsAnalyzedLimit) + startOffset;
    3520           1 :   if (tabsEnd < aRange.end) {
    3521             :     NS_ASSERTION(mReflowing,
    3522             :                  "We need precomputed tab widths, but don't have enough.");
    3523             : 
    3524           1 :     for (uint32_t i = tabsEnd; i < aRange.end; ++i) {
    3525             :       Spacing spacing;
    3526           1 :       GetSpacingInternal(Range(i, i + 1), &spacing, true);
    3527           1 :       mOffsetFromBlockOriginForTabs += spacing.mBefore;
    3528             : 
    3529           1 :       if (!mTextRun->CharIsTab(i)) {
    3530           1 :         if (mTextRun->IsClusterStart(i)) {
    3531             :           uint32_t clusterEnd = i + 1;
    3532           1 :           while (clusterEnd < mTextRun->GetLength() &&
    3533           1 :                  !mTextRun->IsClusterStart(clusterEnd)) {
    3534           0 :             ++clusterEnd;
    3535             :           }
    3536             :           mOffsetFromBlockOriginForTabs +=
    3537           1 :             mTextRun->GetAdvanceWidth(Range(i, clusterEnd), nullptr);
    3538             :         }
    3539             :       } else {
    3540           1 :         if (!mTabWidths) {
    3541           1 :           mTabWidths = new TabWidthStore(mFrame->GetContentOffset());
    3542           1 :           mFrame->Properties().Set(TabWidthProperty(), mTabWidths);
    3543             :         }
    3544             :         double nextTab = AdvanceToNextTab(mOffsetFromBlockOriginForTabs,
    3545           1 :                                           aTabWidth);
    3546             :         mTabWidths->mWidths.AppendElement(TabWidth(i - startOffset,
    3547           1 :                 NSToIntRound(nextTab - mOffsetFromBlockOriginForTabs)));
    3548           1 :         mOffsetFromBlockOriginForTabs = nextTab;
    3549             :       }
    3550             : 
    3551           1 :       mOffsetFromBlockOriginForTabs += spacing.mAfter;
    3552             :     }
    3553             : 
    3554           1 :     if (mTabWidths) {
    3555           1 :       mTabWidths->mLimit = aRange.end - startOffset;
    3556             :     }
    3557             :   }
    3558             : 
    3559           1 :   if (!mTabWidths) {
    3560             :     // Delete any stale property that may be left on the frame
    3561           1 :     mFrame->Properties().Delete(TabWidthProperty());
    3562             :     mTabWidthsAnalyzedLimit = std::max(mTabWidthsAnalyzedLimit,
    3563           1 :                                        aRange.end - startOffset);
    3564             :   }
    3565             : }
    3566             : 
    3567             : gfxFloat
    3568           1 : PropertyProvider::GetHyphenWidth() const
    3569             : {
    3570           1 :   if (mHyphenWidth < 0) {
    3571           1 :     mHyphenWidth = GetFontGroup()->GetHyphenWidth(this);
    3572             :   }
    3573           1 :   return mHyphenWidth + mLetterSpacing;
    3574             : }
    3575             : 
    3576             : static inline bool
    3577           1 : IS_HYPHEN(char16_t u)
    3578             : {
    3579           1 :   return (u == char16_t('-') ||
    3580           1 :           u == 0x058A || // ARMENIAN HYPHEN
    3581           1 :           u == 0x2010 || // HYPHEN
    3582           1 :           u == 0x2012 || // FIGURE DASH
    3583           1 :           u == 0x2013);  // EN DASH
    3584             : }
    3585             : 
    3586             : void
    3587           1 : PropertyProvider::GetHyphenationBreaks(Range aRange, HyphenType* aBreakBefore) const
    3588             : {
    3589             :   NS_PRECONDITION(IsInBounds(mStart, mLength, aRange), "Range out of bounds");
    3590             :   NS_PRECONDITION(mLength != INT32_MAX, "Can't call this with undefined length");
    3591             : 
    3592           1 :   if (!mTextStyle->WhiteSpaceCanWrap(mFrame) ||
    3593           1 :       mTextStyle->mHyphens == StyleHyphens::None)
    3594             :   {
    3595             :     memset(aBreakBefore, static_cast<uint8_t>(HyphenType::None),
    3596           1 :            aRange.Length() * sizeof(HyphenType));
    3597           1 :     return;
    3598             :   }
    3599             : 
    3600             :   // Iterate through the original-string character runs
    3601             :   nsSkipCharsRunIterator run(
    3602           1 :       mStart, nsSkipCharsRunIterator::LENGTH_UNSKIPPED_ONLY, aRange.Length());
    3603           1 :   run.SetSkippedOffset(aRange.start);
    3604             :   // We need to visit skipped characters so that we can detect SHY
    3605           1 :   run.SetVisitSkipped();
    3606             : 
    3607           1 :   int32_t prevTrailingCharOffset = run.GetPos().GetOriginalOffset() - 1;
    3608             :   bool allowHyphenBreakBeforeNextChar =
    3609           1 :     prevTrailingCharOffset >= mStart.GetOriginalOffset() &&
    3610           1 :     prevTrailingCharOffset < mStart.GetOriginalOffset() + mLength &&
    3611           1 :     mFrag->CharAt(prevTrailingCharOffset) == CH_SHY;
    3612             : 
    3613           1 :   while (run.NextRun()) {
    3614             :     NS_ASSERTION(run.GetRunLength() > 0, "Shouldn't return zero-length runs");
    3615           1 :     if (run.IsSkipped()) {
    3616             :       // Check if there's a soft hyphen which would let us hyphenate before
    3617             :       // the next non-skipped character. Don't look at soft hyphens followed
    3618             :       // by other skipped characters, we won't use them.
    3619             :       allowHyphenBreakBeforeNextChar =
    3620           1 :         mFrag->CharAt(run.GetOriginalOffset() + run.GetRunLength() - 1) == CH_SHY;
    3621             :     } else {
    3622           1 :       int32_t runOffsetInSubstring = run.GetSkippedOffset() - aRange.start;
    3623           1 :       memset(aBreakBefore + runOffsetInSubstring,
    3624             :              static_cast<uint8_t>(HyphenType::None),
    3625           1 :              run.GetRunLength() * sizeof(HyphenType));
    3626             :       // Don't allow hyphen breaks at the start of the line
    3627             :       aBreakBefore[runOffsetInSubstring] =
    3628           1 :           allowHyphenBreakBeforeNextChar &&
    3629           1 :           (!(mFrame->GetStateBits() & TEXT_START_OF_LINE) ||
    3630           1 :            run.GetSkippedOffset() > mStart.GetSkippedOffset())
    3631             :           ? HyphenType::Soft
    3632           1 :           : HyphenType::None;
    3633           1 :       allowHyphenBreakBeforeNextChar = false;
    3634             :     }
    3635             :   }
    3636             : 
    3637           1 :   if (mTextStyle->mHyphens == StyleHyphens::Auto) {
    3638           1 :     for (uint32_t i = 0; i < aRange.Length(); ++i) {
    3639           1 :       int32_t fragIndex = mFrag->GetLength() > aRange.end ?
    3640           1 :                           aRange.start + i : i;
    3641           1 :       if (IS_HYPHEN(mFrag->CharAt(fragIndex))) {
    3642           1 :         aBreakBefore[i] = HyphenType::Explicit;
    3643           1 :         continue;
    3644             :       }
    3645             : 
    3646           1 :       if (mTextRun->CanHyphenateBefore(aRange.start + i) &&
    3647           1 :           aBreakBefore[i] == HyphenType::None) {
    3648           1 :         aBreakBefore[i] = HyphenType::AutoWithoutManualInSameWord;
    3649             :       }
    3650             :     }
    3651             :   }
    3652             : }
    3653             : 
    3654             : void
    3655           1 : PropertyProvider::InitializeForDisplay(bool aTrimAfter)
    3656             : {
    3657             :   nsTextFrame::TrimmedOffsets trimmed =
    3658           1 :     mFrame->GetTrimmedOffsets(mFrag, aTrimAfter);
    3659           1 :   mStart.SetOriginalOffset(trimmed.mStart);
    3660           1 :   mLength = trimmed.mLength;
    3661           1 :   SetupJustificationSpacing(true);
    3662           1 : }
    3663             : 
    3664             : void
    3665           1 : PropertyProvider::InitializeForMeasure()
    3666             : {
    3667             :   nsTextFrame::TrimmedOffsets trimmed =
    3668           1 :     mFrame->GetTrimmedOffsets(mFrag, true, false);
    3669           1 :   mStart.SetOriginalOffset(trimmed.mStart);
    3670           1 :   mLength = trimmed.mLength;

    3672           1 : }
    3673             : 
    3674             : 
    3675             : void
    3676           1 : PropertyProvider::SetupJustificationSpacing(bool aPostReflow)
    3677             : {
    3678             :   NS_PRECONDITION(mLength != INT32_MAX, "Can't call this with undefined length");
    3679             : 
    3680           1 :   if (!(mFrame->GetStateBits() & TEXT_JUSTIFICATION_ENABLED)) {

    3701             :     // Nothing to do, nothing is justifiable and we shouldn't have any
    3702             :     // justification space assigned
    3703             :     return;
    3704             :   }
    3705             : 
    3706             :   // Remember that textrun measurements are in the run's orientation,

    3717             :     // No space available

    3719             :   }

    3783           1 :     return true;
    3784             :   }
    3785             :   return false;

    4384             :     // so clear its textrun which may no longer be valid (and don't set ours)
    4385           0 :     prev->ClearTextRuns();

    4425             : 
    4426             : void
    4427           1 : nsContinuingTextFrame::DestroyFrom(nsIFrame* aDestructRoot)
    4428             : {
    4429           1 :   ClearFrameOffsetCache();
    4430             : 
    4431             :   // The text associated with this frame will become associated with our
    4432             :   // prev-continuation. If that means the text has changed style, then
    4433             :   // we need to wipe out the text run for the text.
    4434             :   // Note that mPrevContinuation can be null if we're destroying the whole
    4435             :   // frame chain from the start to the end.
    4436             :   // If this frame is mentioned in the userData for a textrun (say
    4437             :   // because there's a direction change at the start of this frame), then
    4438             :   // we have to clear the textrun because we're going away and the
    4439             :   // textrun had better not keep a dangling reference to us.
    4440           1 :   if (IsInTextRunUserData() ||
    4441           1 :       (mPrevContinuation &&
    4442           1 :        mPrevContinuation->StyleContext() != StyleContext())) {
    4443           1 :     ClearTextRuns();
    4444             :     // Clear the previous continuation's text run also, so that it can rebuild
    4445             :     // the text run to include our text.
    4446           1 :     if (mPrevContinuation) {
    4447           1 :       mPrevContinuation->ClearTextRuns();
    4448             :     }
    4449             :   }
    4450           1 :   nsSplittableFrame::RemoveFromFlow(this);
    4451             :   // Let the base class destroy the frame
    4452           1 :   nsFrame::DestroyFrom(aDestructRoot);
    4453           1 : }

    4747           1 :                               NS_FRAME_IS_DIRTY);

    4757             :     // Below, frames that start after the deleted text will be adjusted so that
    4758             :     // their offsets move with the trailing unchanged text. If this change
    4759             :     // deletes more text than it inserts, those frame offsets will decrease.
    4760             :     // We need to maintain the invariant that mContentOffset is non-decreasing
    4761             :     // along the continuation chain. So we need to ensure that frames that
    4762             :     // started in the deleted text are all still starting before the
    4763             :     // unchanged text.

    4770             : 
    4771             :   // This is how much the length of the string changed by --- i.e.,
    4772             :   // how much the trailing unchanged text moved.

    4774           1 :     aInfo->mChangeStart + aInfo->mReplaceLength - aInfo->mChangeEnd;
    4775             : 
    4776           1 :   if (sizeChange) {
    4777             :     // Fix the offsets of the text frames that start in the trailing
    4778             :     // unchanged text.
    4779           1 :     while (textFrame) {
    4780           1 :       textFrame->mContentOffset += sizeChange;

    4786             :   }

    5093             : void
    5094           1 : nsDisplayText::RenderToContext(gfxContext* aCtx, nsDisplayListBuilder* aBuilder, bool aIsRecording)
    5095             : {
    5096           1 :   nsTextFrame* f = static_cast<nsTextFrame*>(mFrame);
    5097             : 
    5098             :   // Add 1 pixel of dirty area around mVisibleRect to allow us to paint
    5099             :   // antialiased pixels beyond the measured text extents.
    5100             :   // This is temporary until we do this in the actual calculation of text extents.
    5101           1 :   auto A2D = mFrame->PresContext()->AppUnitsPerDevPixel();
    5102             :   LayoutDeviceRect extraVisible =
    5103           1 :     LayoutDeviceRect::FromAppUnits(mVisibleRect, A2D);
    5104           1 :   extraVisible.Inflate(1);
    5105             : 
    5106             :   gfxContextAutoSaveRestore save(aCtx);
    5107             : 
    5108             :   gfxRect pixelVisible(extraVisible.x, extraVisible.y,
    5109           1 :                        extraVisible.width, extraVisible.height);
    5110           1 :   pixelVisible.Inflate(2);
    5111           1 :   pixelVisible.RoundOut();
    5112             : 
    5113           1 :   if (!aBuilder->IsForGenerateGlyphMask() &&
    5114           1 :       !aBuilder->IsForPaintingSelectionBG() &&
    5115             :       !aIsRecording) {
    5116           1 :     aCtx->NewPath();
    5117           1 :     aCtx->Rectangle(pixelVisible);
    5118           1 :     aCtx->Clip();
    5119             :   }
    5120             : 
    5121             :   NS_ASSERTION(mVisIStartEdge >= 0, "illegal start edge");
    5122             :   NS_ASSERTION(mVisIEndEdge >= 0, "illegal end edge");
    5123             : 
    5124           1 :   nsPoint framePt = ToReferenceFrame();
    5125           1 :   if (f->StyleContext()->IsTextCombined()) {
    5126           0 :     float scaleFactor = GetTextCombineScaleFactor(f);
    5127           0 :     if (scaleFactor != 1.0f) {
    5128             :       // Setup matrix to compress text for text-combine-upright if
    5129             :       // necessary. This is done here because we want selection be
    5130             :       // compressed at the same time as text.
    5131           0 :       gfxPoint pt = nsLayoutUtils::PointToGfxPoint(framePt, A2D);

    5134           0 :       aCtx->SetMatrix(mat);

    5253             : // Attempt to get the LineBaselineOffset property of aChildFrame

    5255             : static nscoord
    5256           1 : LazyGetLineBaselineOffset(nsIFrame* aChildFrame, nsBlockFrame* aBlockFrame)
    5257             : {
    5258             :   bool offsetFound;
    5259             :   nscoord offset = aChildFrame->Properties().Get(
    5260           1 :     nsIFrame::LineBaselineOffset(), &offsetFound);
    5261             : 
    5262           1 :   if (!offsetFound) {
    5263           1 :     for (nsBlockFrame::LineIterator line = aBlockFrame->LinesBegin(),
    5264           1 :                                     line_end = aBlockFrame->LinesEnd();
    5265             :          line != line_end; line++) {
    5266           1 :       if (line->IsInline()) {
    5267           1 :         int32_t n = line->GetChildCount();

    5269           1 :         for (nsIFrame* lineFrame = line->mFirstChild;
    5270             :              n > 0; lineFrame = lineFrame->GetNextSibling(), --n) {
    5271           1 :           offset = lineBaseline - lineFrame->GetNormalPosition().y;
    5272           1 :           lineFrame->Properties().Set(nsIFrame::LineBaselineOffset(), offset);
    5273             :         }
    5274             :       }
    5275             :     }
    5276             :     return aChildFrame->Properties().Get(
    5277           1 :       nsIFrame::LineBaselineOffset(), &offsetFound);

    5295             : void
    5296           1 : nsTextFrame::GetTextDecorations(
    5297             :                     nsPresContext* aPresContext,
    5298             :                     nsTextFrame::TextDecorationColorResolution aColorResolution,
    5299             :                     nsTextFrame::TextDecorations& aDecorations)
    5300             : {
    5301           1 :   const nsCompatibility compatMode = aPresContext->CompatibilityMode();
    5302             : 
    5303           1 :   bool useOverride = false;
    5304           1 :   nscolor overrideColor = NS_RGBA(0, 0, 0, 0);
    5305             : 
    5306           1 :   bool nearestBlockFound = false;
    5307             :   // Use writing mode of parent frame for orthogonal text frame to work.
    5308             :   // See comment in nsTextFrame::DrawTextRunAndDecorations.
    5309           1 :   WritingMode wm = GetParent()->GetWritingMode();
    5310           1 :   bool vertical = wm.IsVertical();
    5311             : 
    5312           1 :   nscoord ascent = GetLogicalBaseline(wm);
    5313             :   // physicalBlockStartOffset represents the offset from our baseline
    5314             :   // to f's physical block start, which is top in horizontal writing
    5315             :   // mode, and left in vertical writing modes, in our coordinate space.
    5316             :   // This physical block start is logical block start in most cases,
    5317             :   // but for vertical-rl, it is logical block end, and consequently in
    5318             :   // that case, it starts from the descent instead of ascent.
    5319             :   nscoord physicalBlockStartOffset =
    5320           1 :     wm.IsVerticalRL() ? GetSize().width - ascent : ascent;
    5321             :   // baselineOffset represents the offset from our baseline to f's baseline or
    5322             :   // the nearest block's baseline, in our coordinate space, whichever is closest
    5323             :   // during the particular iteration
    5324           1 :   nscoord baselineOffset = 0;
    5325             : 
    5326           1 :   for (nsIFrame* f = this, *fChild = nullptr;
    5327             :        f;
    5328             :        fChild = f,
    5329             :        f = nsLayoutUtils::GetParentOrPlaceholderFor(f))
    5330             :   {
    5331           1 :     nsStyleContext *const context = f->StyleContext();
    5332           1 :     if (!context->HasTextDecorationLines()) {
    5333             :       break;
    5334             :     }
    5335             : 
    5336           1 :     const nsStyleTextReset *const styleText = context->StyleTextReset();
    5337           1 :     const uint8_t textDecorations = styleText->mTextDecorationLine;
    5338             : 
    5339           1 :     if (!useOverride &&
    5340           1 :         (NS_STYLE_TEXT_DECORATION_LINE_OVERRIDE_ALL & textDecorations)) {
    5341             :       // This handles the <a href="blah.html"><font color="green">La
    5342             :       // la la</font></a> case. The link underline should be green.
    5343           0 :       useOverride = true;
    5344             :       overrideColor =
    5345           0 :         nsLayoutUtils::GetColor(f, &nsStyleTextReset::mTextDecorationColor);
    5346             :     }
    5347             : 
    5348           1 :     nsBlockFrame* fBlock = nsLayoutUtils::GetAsBlock(f);
    5349           1 :     const bool firstBlock = !nearestBlockFound && fBlock;
    5350             : 
    5351             :     // Not updating positions once we hit a parent block is equivalent to
    5352             :     // the CSS 2.1 spec that blocks should propagate decorations down to their
    5353             :     // children (albeit the style should be preserved)
    5354             :     // However, if we're vertically aligned within a block, then we need to
    5355             :     // recover the correct baseline from the line by querying the FrameProperty
    5356             :     // that should be set (see nsLineLayout::VerticalAlignLine).
    5357           1 :     if (firstBlock) {
    5358             :       // At this point, fChild can't be null since TextFrames can't be blocks
    5359           1 :       if (fChild->VerticalAlignEnum() != NS_STYLE_VERTICAL_ALIGN_BASELINE) {
    5360             : 
    5361             :         // Since offset is the offset in the child's coordinate space, we have
    5362             :         // to undo the accumulation to bring the transform out of the block's
    5363             :         // coordinate space
    5364             :         const nscoord lineBaselineOffset = LazyGetLineBaselineOffset(fChild,
    5365           1 :                                                                      fBlock);

    5367           1 :         baselineOffset = physicalBlockStartOffset - lineBaselineOffset -
    5368             :           (vertical ? fChild->GetNormalPosition().x
    5369           1 :                     : fChild->GetNormalPosition().y);
    5370             :       }
    5371             :     }
    5372           1 :     else if (!nearestBlockFound) {
    5373             :       // offset here is the offset from f's baseline to f's top/left
    5374             :       // boundary. It's descent for vertical-rl, and ascent otherwise.
    5375             :       nscoord offset = wm.IsVerticalRL() ?
    5376           0 :         f->GetSize().width - f->GetLogicalBaseline(wm) :
    5377           1 :         f->GetLogicalBaseline(wm);
    5378           1 :       baselineOffset = physicalBlockStartOffset - offset;
    5379             :     }
    5380             : 
    5381           1 :     nearestBlockFound = nearestBlockFound || firstBlock;
    5382             :     physicalBlockStartOffset +=
    5383           1 :       vertical ? f->GetNormalPosition().x : f->GetNormalPosition().y;
    5384             : 
    5385           1 :     const uint8_t style = styleText->mTextDecorationStyle;
    5386           1 :     if (textDecorations) {
    5387             :       nscolor color;
    5388           1 :       if (useOverride) {
    5389             :         color = overrideColor;
    5390           1 :       } else if (nsSVGUtils::IsInSVGTextSubtree(this)) {
    5391             :         // XXX We might want to do something with text-decoration-color when
    5392             :         //     painting SVG text, but it's not clear what we should do.  We

    5428             :     // In all modes, if we're on an inline-block or inline-table (or

    5517             : nsRect
    5518           1 : nsTextFrame::UpdateTextEmphasis(WritingMode aWM, PropertyProvider& aProvider)
    5519             : {
    5520           1 :   const nsStyleText* styleText = StyleText();
    5521           1 :   if (!styleText->HasTextEmphasis()) {
    5522           1 :     Properties().Delete(EmphasisMarkProperty());
    5523             :     return nsRect();
    5524             :   }
    5525             : 
    5526           0 :   nsStyleContext* styleContext = StyleContext();
    5527           0 :   bool isTextCombined = styleContext->IsTextCombined();
    5528           0 :   if (isTextCombined) {
    5529           0 :     styleContext = styleContext->GetParent();
    5530             :   }
    5531             :   RefPtr<nsFontMetrics> fm = nsLayoutUtils::
    5532           0 :     GetFontMetricsOfEmphasisMarks(styleContext, GetFontSizeInflation());
    5533           0 :   EmphasisMarkInfo* info = new EmphasisMarkInfo;
    5534           0 :   info->textRun =
    5535           0 :     GenerateTextRunForEmphasisMarks(this, fm, styleContext, styleText);
    5536           0 :   info->advance = info->textRun->GetAdvanceWidth();
    5537             : 
    5538             :   // Calculate the baseline offset
    5539           0 :   LogicalSide side = styleText->TextEmphasisSide(aWM);
    5540           0 :   LogicalSize frameSize = GetLogicalSize(aWM);
    5541             :   // The overflow rect is inflated in the inline direction by half
    5542             :   // advance of the emphasis mark on each side, so that even if a mark
    5543             :   // is drawn for a zero-width character, it won't be clipped.
    5544           0 :   LogicalRect overflowRect(aWM, -info->advance / 2,
    5545             :                            /* BStart to be computed below */ 0,
    5546           0 :                            frameSize.ISize(aWM) + info->advance,
    5547           0 :                            fm->MaxAscent() + fm->MaxDescent());
    5548             :   RefPtr<nsFontMetrics> baseFontMetrics = isTextCombined
    5549           0 :     ? nsLayoutUtils::GetInflatedFontMetricsForFrame(GetParent())
    5550           0 :     : do_AddRef(aProvider.GetFontMetrics());
    5551             :   // When the writing mode is vertical-lr the line is inverted, and thus
    5552             :   // the ascent and descent are swapped.
    5553           0 :   nscoord absOffset = (side == eLogicalSideBStart) != aWM.IsLineInverted() ?
    5554           0 :     baseFontMetrics->MaxAscent() + fm->MaxDescent() :
    5555           0 :     baseFontMetrics->MaxDescent() + fm->MaxAscent();
    5556           0 :   RubyBlockLeadings leadings;
    5557           0 :   if (nsRubyFrame* ruby = FindFurthestInlineRubyAncestor(this)) {
    5558           0 :     leadings = ruby->GetBlockLeadings();
    5559             :   }
    5560           0 :   if (side == eLogicalSideBStart) {
    5561           0 :     info->baselineOffset = -absOffset - leadings.mStart;
    5562           0 :     overflowRect.BStart(aWM) = -overflowRect.BSize(aWM) - leadings.mStart;
    5563             :   } else {
    5564             :     MOZ_ASSERT(side == eLogicalSideBEnd);
    5565           0 :     info->baselineOffset = absOffset + leadings.mEnd;
    5566           0 :     overflowRect.BStart(aWM) = frameSize.BSize(aWM) + leadings.mEnd;
    5567             :   }
    5568             :   // If text combined, fix the gap between the text frame and its parent.
    5569           0 :   if (isTextCombined) {
    5570           0 :     nscoord gap = (baseFontMetrics->MaxHeight() - frameSize.BSize(aWM)) / 2;
    5571           0 :     overflowRect.BStart(aWM) += gap * (side == eLogicalSideBStart ? -1 : 1);
    5572             :   }
    5573             : 
    5574           0 :   Properties().Set(EmphasisMarkProperty(), info);
    5575           0 :   return overflowRect.GetPhysicalRect(aWM, frameSize.GetPhysicalSize(aWM));
    5576             : }
    5577             : 
    5578             : void
    5579           1 : nsTextFrame::UnionAdditionalOverflow(nsPresContext* aPresContext,
    5580             :                                      nsIFrame* aBlock,
    5581             :                                      PropertyProvider& aProvider,
    5582             :                                      nsRect* aVisualOverflowRect,
    5583             :                                      bool aIncludeTextDecorations)
    5584             : {
    5585           1 :   const WritingMode wm = GetWritingMode();
    5586           1 :   bool verticalRun = mTextRun->IsVertical();
    5587           1 :   const gfxFloat appUnitsPerDevUnit = aPresContext->AppUnitsPerDevPixel();
    5588             : 
    5589           1 :   if (IsFloatingFirstLetterChild()) {
    5590           1 :     bool inverted = wm.IsLineInverted();
    5591             :     // The underline/overline drawable area must be contained in the overflow
    5592             :     // rect when this is in floating first letter frame at *both* modes.
    5593             :     // In this case, aBlock is the ::first-letter frame.
    5594             :     uint8_t decorationStyle = aBlock->StyleContext()->

    5598             :     // reflow.

    5601             :     }

    5639             :     bool useVerticalMetrics = verticalDec != verticalRun
    5640           1 :       ? verticalDec : verticalRun && mTextRun->UseCenterBaseline();
    5641             : 
    5642             :     // Since CSS 2.1 requires that text-decoration defined on ancestors maintain
    5643             :     // style and position, they can be drawn at virtually any y-offset, so
    5644             :     // maxima and minima are required to reliably generate the rectangle for
    5645             :     // them

    5650           1 :         nsLayoutUtils::InflationMinFontSizeFor(aBlock);
    5651             : 
    5652           1 :       const nscoord measure = verticalDec ? GetSize().height : GetSize().width;
    5653           1 :       gfxFloat gfxWidth = measure / appUnitsPerDevUnit;

    5655           1 :                           / appUnitsPerDevUnit;

    5658           0 :         frameBStart = GetSize().width;

    5660             :       }

    5662             :       // so we will multiply the values from metrics by this factor.
    5663           1 :       gfxFloat decorationOffsetDir = mTextRun->IsSidewaysLeft() ? -1.0 : 1.0;

    5670           1 :       nscoord topOrLeft(nscoord_MAX), bottomOrRight(nscoord_MIN);

    5672             :       auto accumulateDecorationRect = [&](const LineDecoration& dec,
    5673             :                                           gfxFloat Metrics::* lineSize,
    5674           1 :                                           gfxFloat Metrics::* lineOffset) {
    5675           1 :         params.style = dec.mStyle;

    5687           1 :                               useVerticalMetrics);

    5694           1 :                        : nsPoint(0, -dec.mBaselineOffset));

    5696           1 :         if (verticalDec) {

    5698           0 :           bottomOrRight = std::max(decorationRect.XMost(), bottomOrRight);
    5699             :         } else {
    5700           1 :           topOrLeft = std::min(decorationRect.y, topOrLeft);
    5701           1 :           bottomOrRight = std::max(decorationRect.YMost(), bottomOrRight);
    5702             :         }
    5703           1 :       };

    5705             :       // Below we loop through all text decorations and compute the rectangle
    5706             :       // containing all of them, in this frame's coordinate space

    5710           1 :                                  &Metrics::underlineOffset);

    5757             : gfxFloat
    5758           1 : nsTextFrame::ComputeDescentLimitForSelectionUnderline(

    5769           1 :     return aFontMetrics.maxDescent;
    5770             :   }
    5771           1 :   return aFontMetrics.maxDescent + (lineHeight - aFontMetrics.maxHeight) / 2;

    5774             :

    5784             : /* static */
    5785             : gfxFloat
    5786           1 : nsTextFrame::ComputeSelectionUnderlineHeight(

    5789             :                SelectionType aSelectionType)
    5790             : {
    5791             :   switch (aSelectionType) {
    5792             :     case SelectionType::eIMERawClause:

    5796           1 :       return aFontMetrics.underlineSize;
    5797             :     case SelectionType::eSpellCheck: {
    5798             :       // The thickness of the spellchecker underline shouldn't honor the font
    5799             :       // metrics.  It should be constant pixels value which is decided from the
    5800             :       // default font size.  Note that if the actual font size is smaller than
    5801             :       // the default font size, we should use the actual font size because the
    5802             :       // computed value from the default font size can be too thick for the
    5803             :       // current font size.

    5808             :       gfxFloat fontSize = std::min(gfxFloat(zoomedFontSize),
    5809           1 :                                    aFontMetrics.emHeight);
    5810           1 :       fontSize = std::max(fontSize, 1.0);
    5811           1 :       return ceil(fontSize / 20);
    5812             :     }
    5813             :     default:
    5814             :       NS_WARNING("Requested underline style is not valid");
    5815           0 :       return aFontMetrics.underlineSize;
    5816             :   }

    5858             : /**
    5859             :  * This, plus kRawSelectionTypesWithDecorations, encapsulates all knowledge

    5861             :  */
    5862             : void
    5863           1 : nsTextFrame::DrawSelectionDecorations(gfxContext* aContext,
    5864             :                                       const LayoutDeviceRect& aDirtyRect,
    5865             :                                       SelectionType aSelectionType,

    5890             :   params.descentLimit =
    5891             :     ComputeDescentLimitForSelectionUnderline(aTextPaintStyle.PresContext(),
    5892           1 :                                              aFontMetrics);
    5893             : 
    5894             :   float relativeSize;
    5895             : 
    5896           1 :   switch (aSelectionType) {
    5897             :     case SelectionType::eIMERawClause:
    5898             :     case SelectionType::eIMESelectedRawClause:
    5899             :     case SelectionType::eIMEConvertedClause:
    5900             :     case SelectionType::eIMESelectedClause:
    5901             :     case SelectionType::eSpellCheck: {
    5902             :       int32_t index = nsTextPaintStyle::
    5903           1 :         GetUnderlineStyleIndexForSelectionType(aSelectionType);
    5904             :       bool weDefineSelectionUnderline =
    5905             :         aTextPaintStyle.GetSelectionUnderlineForPaint(index, &params.color,
    5906             :                                                       &relativeSize,
    5907           1 :                                                       &params.style);
    5908             :       params.lineSize.height =
    5909             :         ComputeSelectionUnderlineHeight(aTextPaintStyle.PresContext(),
    5910           1 :                                         aFontMetrics, aSelectionType);
    5911           1 :       bool isIMEType = aSelectionType != SelectionType::eSpellCheck;
    5912             : 
    5913           1 :       if (isIMEType) {
    5914             :         // IME decoration lines should not be drawn on the both ends, i.e., we
    5915             :         // need to cut both edges of the decoration lines.  Because same style
    5916             :         // IME selections can adjoin, but the users need to be able to know
    5917             :         // where are the boundaries of the selections.
    5918             :         //
    5919             :         //  X: underline
    5920             :         //
    5921             :         //     IME selection #1        IME selection #2      IME selection #3
    5922             :         //  |                     |                      |
    5923             :         //  | XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX | XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX | XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX
    5924             :         //  +---------------------+----------------------+--------------------
    5925             :         //   ^                   ^ ^                    ^ ^
    5926             :         //  gap                  gap                    gap
    5927           1 :         params.pt.x += 1.0;
    5928           1 :         params.lineSize.width -= 2.0;
    5929             :       }
    5930           1 :       if (isIMEType && aRangeStyle.IsDefined()) {
    5931             :         // If IME defines the style, that should override our definition.
    5932           0 :         if (aRangeStyle.IsLineStyleDefined()) {
    5933           0 :           if (aRangeStyle.mLineStyle == TextRangeStyle::LINESTYLE_NONE) {
    5934           1 :             return;
    5935             :           }
    5936           0 :           params.style = aRangeStyle.mLineStyle;
    5937           0 :           relativeSize = aRangeStyle.mIsBoldLine ? 2.0f : 1.0f;
    5938           0 :         } else if (!weDefineSelectionUnderline) {
    5939             :           // There is no underline style definition.
    5940             :           return;
    5941             :         }
    5942             :         // If underline color is defined and that doesn't depend on the
    5943             :         // foreground color, we should use the color directly.
    5944           0 :         if (aRangeStyle.IsUnderlineColorDefined() &&
    5945           0 :             (!aRangeStyle.IsForegroundColorDefined() ||
    5946           0 :              aRangeStyle.mUnderlineColor != aRangeStyle.mForegroundColor)) {
    5947           0 :           params.color = aRangeStyle.mUnderlineColor;
    5948             :         }
    5949             :         // If foreground color or background color is defined, the both colors
    5950             :         // are computed by GetSelectionTextColors().  Then, we should use its
    5951             :         // foreground color always.  The color should have sufficient contrast
    5952             :         // with the background color.
    5953           0 :         else if (aRangeStyle.IsForegroundColorDefined() ||
    5954           0 :                  aRangeStyle.IsBackgroundColorDefined()) {
    5955             :           nscolor bg;
    5956             :           GetSelectionTextColors(aSelectionType, aTextPaintStyle,
    5957           0 :                                  aRangeStyle, &params.color, &bg);
    5958             :         }
    5959             :         // Otherwise, use the foreground color of the frame.
    5960             :         else {
    5961           0 :           params.color = aTextPaintStyle.GetTextColor();
    5962             :         }
    5963           1 :       } else if (!weDefineSelectionUnderline) {
    5964             :         // IME doesn't specify the selection style and we don't define selection
    5965             :         // underline.
    5966             :         return;
    5967             :       }
    5968             :       break;
    5969             :     }
    5970             :     case SelectionType::eURLStrikeout: {
    5971             :       nscoord inflationMinFontSize =
    5972           1 :         nsLayoutUtils::InflationMinFontSizeFor(this);
    5973             :       float inflation =
    5974           1 :         GetInflationForTextDecorations(this, inflationMinFontSize);
    5975             :       const gfxFont::Metrics metrics =
    5976           1 :         GetFirstFontMetrics(GetFontGroupForFrame(this, inflation), aVertical);
    5977             : 
    5978           1 :       relativeSize = 2.0f;
    5979           1 :       aTextPaintStyle.GetURLSecondaryColor(&params.color);
    5980           1 :       params.style = NS_STYLE_TEXT_DECORATION_STYLE_SOLID;
    5981           1 :       params.lineSize.height = metrics.strikeoutSize;
    5982           1 :       params.offset = metrics.strikeoutOffset + 0.5;
    5983           1 :       params.decoration = NS_STYLE_TEXT_DECORATION_LINE_LINE_THROUGH;
    5984             :       break;
    5985             :     }
    5986             :     default:
    5987             :       NS_WARNING("Requested selection decorations when there aren't any");
    5988             :       return;
    5989             :   }
    5990           1 :   params.offset *= aDecorationOffsetDir;
    5991           1 :   params.lineSize.height *= relativeSize;
    5992           1 :   params.icoordInFrame = (aVertical ? params.pt.y - aPt.y
    5993           1 :                                     : params.pt.x - aPt.x) + aICoordInFrame;
    5994           1 :   PaintDecorationLine(params);
    5995             : }
    5996             : 
    5997             : /* static */
    5998             : bool
    5999           1 : nsTextFrame::GetSelectionTextColors(SelectionType aSelectionType,
    6000             :                                     nsTextPaintStyle& aTextPaintStyle,
    6001             :                                     const TextRangeStyle &aRangeStyle,
    6002             :                                     nscolor* aForeground,
    6003             :                                     nscolor* aBackground)
    6004             : {
    6005           1 :   switch (aSelectionType) {
    6006             :     case SelectionType::eNormal:
    6007           1 :       return aTextPaintStyle.GetSelectionColors(aForeground, aBackground);
    6008             :     case SelectionType::eFind:
    6009           1 :       aTextPaintStyle.GetHighlightColors(aForeground, aBackground);
    6010           1 :       return true;
    6011             :     case SelectionType::eURLSecondary:
    6012           1 :       aTextPaintStyle.GetURLSecondaryColor(aForeground);
    6013           1 :       *aBackground = NS_RGBA(0,0,0,0);
    6014           1 :       return true;
    6015             :     case SelectionType::eIMERawClause:
    6016             :     case SelectionType::eIMESelectedRawClause:
    6017             :     case SelectionType::eIMEConvertedClause:
    6018             :     case SelectionType::eIMESelectedClause:
    6019           1 :       if (aRangeStyle.IsDefined()) {
    6020           0 :         if (!aRangeStyle.IsForegroundColorDefined() &&
    6021           0 :             !aRangeStyle.IsBackgroundColorDefined()) {
    6022           0 :           *aForeground = aTextPaintStyle.GetTextColor();
    6023           0 :           *aBackground = NS_RGBA(0,0,0,0);
    6024           0 :           return false;
    6025             :         }
    6026           0 :         if (aRangeStyle.IsForegroundColorDefined()) {
    6027           0 :           *aForeground = aRangeStyle.mForegroundColor;
    6028           0 :           if (aRangeStyle.IsBackgroundColorDefined()) {
    6029           0 :             *aBackground = aRangeStyle.mBackgroundColor;
    6030             :           } else {
    6031             :             // If foreground color is defined but background color isn't
    6032             :             // defined, we can guess that IME must expect that the background
    6033             :             // color is system's default field background color.
    6034           0 :             *aBackground = aTextPaintStyle.GetSystemFieldBackgroundColor();

    6036             :         } else { // aRangeStyle.IsBackgroundColorDefined() is true
    6037           0 :           *aBackground = aRangeStyle.mBackgroundColor;

    6040             :           // same as system's field text color.
    6041           0 :           *aForeground = aTextPaintStyle.GetSystemFieldForegroundColor();

    6057             : /**

    6076             : /**

    6084             : public:
    6085             :   /**

    6100             :    * for RTL)

    6135             : 
    6136           1 : bool SelectionIterator::GetNextSegment(gfxFloat* aXOffset,

    6216             :   // This rect is the box which is equivalent to where the shadow will be painted.
    6217             :   // The origin of aBoundingBox is the text baseline left, so we must translate it by
    6218             :   // that much in order to make the origin the top-left corner of the text bounding box.

    6286             : // Paints selection backgrounds and text in the correct colors. Also computes
    6287             : // aAllTypes, the union of all selection types that are applying to this text.
    6288             : bool
    6289           1 : nsTextFrame::PaintTextWithSelectionColors(

    6454             : void
    6455           1 : nsTextFrame::PaintTextSelectionDecorations(
    6456             :     const PaintTextSelectionParams& aParams,
    6457             :     const UniquePtr<SelectionDetails>& aDetails,
    6458             :     SelectionType aSelectionType)
    6459             : {
    6460             :   // Hide text decorations if we're currently hiding @font-face fallback text
    6461           1 :   if (aParams.provider->GetFontGroup()->ShouldSkipDrawing())

    6463             : 
    6464             :   // Figure out which characters will be decorated for this selection.
    6465             :   // Note: selectedCharsBuffer is keeping extra raw pointers to
    6466             :   // uniquely-owned resources, but it's safe because it's temporary and the
    6467             :   // resources are owned by the caller. Therefore, they'll outlive this object.

    6471           1 :     selectedCharsBuffer.AppendElements(contentRange.Length(), fallible);
    6472           1 :   if (!selectedChars) {
    6473             :     return;
    6474             :   }
    6475           1 :   for (uint32_t i = 0; i < contentRange.Length(); ++i) {
    6476           1 :     selectedChars[i] = nullptr;
    6477             :   }
    6478             : 
    6479           1 :   for (SelectionDetails* sdptr = aDetails.get(); sdptr; sdptr = sdptr->mNext.get()) {

    6481           1 :       int32_t start = std::max(0, sdptr->mStart - int32_t(contentRange.start));
    6482             :       int32_t end = std::min(int32_t(contentRange.Length()),

    6484           1 :       for (int32_t i = start; i < end; ++i) {
    6485           1 :         selectedChars[i] = sdptr;
    6486             :       }
    6487             :     }
    6488             :   }
    6489             : 
    6490           1 :   gfxFont* firstFont = aParams.provider->GetFontGroup()->GetFirstValidFont();

    6738             : bool
    6739           1 : nsTextFrame::MeasureCharClippedText(PropertyProvider& aProvider,
    6740             :                                     nscoord aVisIStartEdge,

    6851             : static bool
    6852           1 : ShouldDrawSelection(const nsIFrame* aFrame)
    6853             : {
    6854             :   // Normal text-with-selection rendering sequence is:
    6855             :   //   * Paint background > Paint text-selection-color > Paint text
    6856             :   // When we have an parent frame with background-clip-text style, rendering
    6857             :   // sequence changes to:
    6858             :   //   * Paint text-selection-color > Paint background > Paint text
    6859             :   //
    6860             :   // If there is a parent frame has background-clip:text style,
    6861             :   // text-selection-color should be drawn with the background of that parent
    6862             :   // frame, so we should not draw it again while painting text frames.
    6863             : 
    6864           1 :   if (!aFrame) {
    6865             :     return true;
    6866             :   }
    6867             : 
    6868           1 :   const nsStyleBackground* bg = aFrame->StyleContext()->StyleBackground();
    6869           1 :   const nsStyleImageLayers& layers = bg->mImage;
    6870           1 :   NS_FOR_VISIBLE_IMAGE_LAYERS_BACK_TO_FRONT(i, layers) {
    6871           1 :     if (layers.mLayers[i].mClip == StyleGeometryBox::Text) {
    6872             :       return false;
    6873             :     }
    6874             :   }
    6875             : 
    6876           1 :   return ShouldDrawSelection(aFrame->GetParent());
    6877             : }
    6878             : 
    6879             : void
    6880           1 : nsTextFrame::PaintText(const PaintTextParams& aParams,
    6881             :                        const nsCharClipDisplayItem& aItem,
    6882             :                        float aOpacity /* = 1.0f */)
    6883             : {

    6885             :   // *reference* context and rendering context might have some transform
    6886             :   // in it
    6887             :   // XXX get the block and line passed to us somehow! This is slow!
    6888           1 :   gfxSkipCharsIterator iter = EnsureTextRun(nsTextFrame::eInflated);
    6889           1 :   if (!mTextRun)
    6890           1 :     return;
    6891             : 
    6892           1 :   PropertyProvider provider(this, iter, nsTextFrame::eInflated);
    6893           1 :   if (aItem.mIsFrameSelected.isNothing()) {
    6894           1 :     aItem.mIsFrameSelected.emplace(IsSelected());
    6895             :   }
    6896             :   // Trim trailing whitespace, unless we're painting a selection highlight,
    6897             :   // which should include trailing spaces if present (bug 1146754).
    6898           1 :   provider.InitializeForDisplay(!aItem.mIsFrameSelected.value());
    6899             : 
    6900           1 :   const bool reversed = mTextRun->IsInlineReversed();
    6901           1 :   const bool verticalRun = mTextRun->IsVertical();

    6904           1 :   const gfxFloat frameHeight = GetSize().height;
    6905             :   gfxPoint textBaselinePt;
    6906           1 :   if (verticalRun) {
    6907           1 :     if (wm.IsVerticalLR()) {
    6908             :       textBaselinePt.x = nsLayoutUtils::GetSnappedBaselineX(
    6909           1 :         this, aParams.context, nscoord(aParams.framePt.x), mAscent);
    6910             :     } else {
    6911             :       textBaselinePt.x = nsLayoutUtils::GetSnappedBaselineX(
    6912           1 :         this, aParams.context, nscoord(aParams.framePt.x) + frameWidth,
    6913           1 :         -mAscent);
    6914             :     }
    6915           1 :     textBaselinePt.y = reversed ? aParams.framePt.y + frameHeight
    6916           1 :                                 : aParams.framePt.y;
    6917             :   } else {
    6918             :     textBaselinePt =
    6919           1 :       gfxPoint(reversed ? aParams.framePt.x + frameWidth : aParams.framePt.x,
    6920             :                nsLayoutUtils::GetSnappedBaselineY(
    6921           1 :                  this, aParams.context, aParams.framePt.y, mAscent));
    6922             :   }
    6923           1 :   Range range = ComputeTransformedRange(provider);
    6924           1 :   uint32_t startOffset = range.start;
    6925           1 :   uint32_t maxLength = range.Length();
    6926             :   nscoord snappedStartEdge, snappedEndEdge;
    6927           1 :   if (!MeasureCharClippedText(provider, aItem.mVisIStartEdge, aItem.mVisIEndEdge,
    6928           1 :          &startOffset, &maxLength, &snappedStartEdge, &snappedEndEdge)) {
    6929           1 :     return;
    6930             :   }
    6931           1 :   if (verticalRun) {
    6932           1 :     textBaselinePt.y += reversed ? -snappedEndEdge : snappedStartEdge;
    6933             :   } else {
    6934           1 :     textBaselinePt.x += reversed ? -snappedEndEdge : snappedStartEdge;
    6935             :   }
    6936             :   nsCharClipDisplayItem::ClipEdges clipEdges(aItem, snappedStartEdge,
    6937           1 :                                              snappedEndEdge);
    6938           1 :   nsTextPaintStyle textPaintStyle(this);
    6939           1 :   textPaintStyle.SetResolveColors(!aParams.callbacks);
    6940             : 
    6941             :   // Fork off to the (slower) paint-with-selection path if necessary.
    6942           1 :   if (aItem.mIsFrameSelected.value() &&
    6943           1 :       (aParams.IsPaintBGColor() || ShouldDrawSelection(this->GetParent()))) {
    6944             :     MOZ_ASSERT(aOpacity == 1.0f, "We don't support opacity with selections!");
    6945           1 :     gfxSkipCharsIterator tmp(provider.GetStart());

    7049             : void

    7077             : void
    7078           1 : nsTextFrame::DrawTextRunAndDecorations(Range aRange,
    7079             :                                        const gfxPoint& aTextBaselinePt,

    7081             :                                        const TextDecorations& aDecorations)
    7082             : {
    7083             :     const gfxFloat app =
    7084           1 :       aParams.textStyle->PresContext()->AppUnitsPerDevPixel();
    7085             :     // Writing mode of parent frame is used because the text frame may
    7086             :     // be orthogonal to its parent when text-combine-upright is used or
    7087             :     // its parent has "display: contents", and in those cases, we want
    7088             :     // to draw the decoration lines according to parents' direction
    7089             :     // rather than ours.
    7090           1 :     const WritingMode wm = GetParent()->GetWritingMode();
    7091           1 :     bool verticalDec = wm.IsVertical();
    7092           1 :     bool verticalRun = mTextRun->IsVertical();
    7093             :     // If the text run and the decoration is orthogonal, we choose the
    7094             :     // metrics for decoration so that decoration line won't be broken.
    7095             :     bool useVerticalMetrics = verticalDec != verticalRun
    7096           1 :       ? verticalDec : verticalRun && mTextRun->UseCenterBaseline();
    7097             : 
    7098             :     // XXX aFramePt is in AppUnits, shouldn't it be nsFloatPoint?
    7099           1 :     nscoord x = NSToCoordRound(aParams.framePt.x);
    7100           1 :     nscoord y = NSToCoordRound(aParams.framePt.y);
    7101             :

    7103             :     // width, while for a vertical run it's the height of the decoration
    7104           1 :     const nsSize frameSize = GetSize();

    7106             : 
    7107           1 :     if (verticalDec) {
    7108           0 :       aParams.clipEdges->Intersect(&y, &measure);
    7109             :     } else {
    7110           1 :       aParams.clipEdges->Intersect(&x, &measure);
    7111             :     }

    7117           1 :     gfxFloat frameBStart = verticalDec ? aParams.framePt.x : aParams.framePt.y;

    7120             :     // right, so we need to adjust here.

    7122           0 :       frameBStart += frameSize.width;
    7123           0 :       ascent = -ascent;
    7124             :     }
    7125             :

    7127           1 :       nsLayoutUtils::InflationMinFontSizeFor(this);

    7130             :     // so we will multiply the values from metrics by this factor.

    7160             : 
    7161             :     typedef gfxFont::Metrics Metrics;

    7281             : 
    7282             : /**
    7283             :  * Compute the longest prefix of text whose width is <= aWidth. Return
    7284             :  * the length of the prefix. Also returns the width of the prefix in aFitWidth.
    7285             :  */
    7286             : static uint32_t
    7287           1 : CountCharsFit(const gfxTextRun* aTextRun, gfxTextRun::Range aRange,
    7288             :               gfxFloat aWidth, PropertyProvider* aProvider,
    7289             :               gfxFloat* aFitWidth)
    7290             : {
    7291           1 :   uint32_t last = 0;
    7292           1 :   gfxFloat width = 0;
    7293           1 :   for (uint32_t i = 1; i <= aRange.Length(); ++i) {
    7294           1 :     if (i == aRange.Length() || aTextRun->IsClusterStart(aRange.start + i)) {
    7295           1 :       gfxTextRun::Range range(aRange.start + last, aRange.start + i);
    7296           1 :       gfxFloat nextWidth = width + aTextRun->GetAdvanceWidth(range, aProvider);
    7297           1 :       if (nextWidth > aWidth)
    7298             :         break;
    7299           1 :       last = i;
    7300           1 :       width = nextWidth;
    7301             :     }
    7302             :   }
    7303           1 :   *aFitWidth = width;
    7304           1 :   return last;
    7305             : }
