    7318             : 
    7319             : nsIFrame::ContentOffsets
    7320           1 : nsTextFrame::GetCharacterOffsetAtFramePointInternal(nsPoint aPoint,
    7321             :                                                     bool aForInsertionPoint)
    7322             : {
    7323             :   ContentOffsets offsets;
    7324             : 
    7325           1 :   gfxSkipCharsIterator iter = EnsureTextRun(nsTextFrame::eInflated);
    7326           1 :   if (!mTextRun)
    7327             :     return offsets;
    7328             : 
    7329           1 :   PropertyProvider provider(this, iter, nsTextFrame::eInflated);
    7330             :   // Trim leading but not trailing whitespace if possible
    7331           1 :   provider.InitializeForDisplay(false);
    7332           1 :   gfxFloat width = mTextRun->IsVertical()
    7333           0 :     ? (mTextRun->IsInlineReversed() ? mRect.height - aPoint.y : aPoint.y)
    7334           1 :     : (mTextRun->IsInlineReversed() ? mRect.width - aPoint.x : aPoint.x);
    7335           1 :   if (StyleContext()->IsTextCombined()) {
    7336           0 :     width /= GetTextCombineScaleFactor(this);
    7337             :   }
    7338             :   gfxFloat fitWidth;
    7339           1 :   Range skippedRange = ComputeTransformedRange(provider);
    7340             : 
    7341             :   uint32_t charsFit = CountCharsFit(mTextRun, skippedRange,
    7342           1 :                                     width, &provider, &fitWidth);
    7343             : 
    7344             :   int32_t selectedOffset;
    7345           1 :   if (charsFit < skippedRange.Length()) {
    7346             :     // charsFit characters fitted, but no more could fit. See if we're
    7347             :     // more than halfway through the cluster.. If we are, choose the next
    7348             :     // cluster.
    7349           1 :     gfxSkipCharsIterator extraCluster(provider.GetStart());
    7350           1 :     extraCluster.AdvanceSkipped(charsFit);
    7351             : 
    7352           1 :     bool allowSplitLigature = true; // Allow selection of partial ligature...
    7353             : 
    7354             :     // ...but don't let selection/insertion-point split two Regional Indicator
    7355             :     // chars that are ligated in the textrun to form a single flag symbol.
    7356           1 :     uint32_t offs = extraCluster.GetOriginalOffset();
    7357           1 :     const nsTextFragment* frag = GetContent()->GetText();
    7358           1 :     if (offs + 1 < frag->GetLength() &&
    7359           1 :         NS_IS_HIGH_SURROGATE(frag->CharAt(offs)) &&
    7360           1 :         NS_IS_LOW_SURROGATE(frag->CharAt(offs + 1)) &&
    7361             :         gfxFontUtils::IsRegionalIndicator
    7362           0 :           (SURROGATE_TO_UCS4(frag->CharAt(offs), frag->CharAt(offs + 1)))) {
    7363           0 :       allowSplitLigature = false;
    7364           0 :       if (extraCluster.GetSkippedOffset() > 1 &&
    7365           0 :           !mTextRun->IsLigatureGroupStart(extraCluster.GetSkippedOffset())) {
    7366             :         // CountCharsFit() left us in the middle of the flag; back up over the
    7367             :         // first character of the ligature, and adjust fitWidth accordingly.
    7368           0 :         extraCluster.AdvanceSkipped(-2); // it's a surrogate pair: 2 code units
    7369             :         fitWidth -= mTextRun->GetAdvanceWidth(
    7370             :           Range(extraCluster.GetSkippedOffset(),
    7371           0 :                 extraCluster.GetSkippedOffset() + 2), &provider);
    7372             :       }
    7373             :     }
    7374             : 
    7375           1 :     gfxSkipCharsIterator extraClusterLastChar(extraCluster);
    7376             :     FindClusterEnd(mTextRun,
    7377           1 :                    provider.GetStart().GetOriginalOffset() + provider.GetOriginalLength(),
    7378           1 :                    &extraClusterLastChar, allowSplitLigature);
    7379             :     PropertyProvider::Spacing spacing;
    7380             :     Range extraClusterRange(extraCluster.GetSkippedOffset(),
    7381           1 :                             extraClusterLastChar.GetSkippedOffset() + 1);
    7382             :     gfxFloat charWidth =
    7383           1 :         mTextRun->GetAdvanceWidth(extraClusterRange, &provider, &spacing);
    7384           1 :     charWidth -= spacing.mBefore + spacing.mAfter;
    7385           1 :     selectedOffset = !aForInsertionPoint ||
    7386           1 :       width <= fitWidth + spacing.mBefore + charWidth/2
    7387             :         ? extraCluster.GetOriginalOffset()
    7388           1 :         : extraClusterLastChar.GetOriginalOffset() + 1;
    7389             :   } else {
    7390             :     // All characters fitted, we're at (or beyond) the end of the text.
    7391             :     // XXX This could be some pathological situation where negative spacing
    7392             :     // caused characters to move backwards. We can't really handle that
    7393             :     // in the current frame system because frames can't have negative
    7394             :     // intrinsic widths.
    7395             :     selectedOffset =
    7396           1 :         provider.GetStart().GetOriginalOffset() + provider.GetOriginalLength();
    7397             :     // If we're at the end of a preformatted line which has a terminating
    7398             :     // linefeed, we want to reduce the offset by one to make sure that the

    7804             : 
    7805             : /**
    7806             :  * This class iterates through the clusters before or after the given
    7807             :  * aPosition (which is a content offset). You can test each cluster
    7808             :  * to see if it's whitespace (as far as selection/caret movement is concerned),
    7809             :  * or punctuation, or if there is a word break before the cluster. ("Before"
    7810             :  * is interpreted according to aDirection, so if aDirection is -1, "before"
    7811             :  * means actually *after* the cluster content.)
    7812             :  */
    7813           1 : class MOZ_STACK_CLASS ClusterIterator {
    7814             : public:
    7815             :   ClusterIterator(nsTextFrame* aTextFrame, int32_t aPosition, int32_t aDirection,

    7835             : 
    7836             : static bool
    7837           1 : IsAcceptableCaretPosition(const gfxSkipCharsIterator& aIter,
    7838             :                           bool aRespectClusters,
    7839             :                           const gfxTextRun* aTextRun,
    7840             :                           nsIFrame* aFrame)
    7841             : {
    7842           1 :   if (aIter.IsOriginalCharSkipped())
    7843             :     return false;
    7844           1 :   uint32_t index = aIter.GetSkippedOffset();
    7845           1 :   if (aRespectClusters && !aTextRun->IsClusterStart(index))
    7846             :     return false;
    7847           1 :   if (index > 0) {
    7848             :     // Check whether the proposed position is in between the two halves of a
    7849             :     // surrogate pair, or before a Variation Selector character;
    7850             :     // if so, this is not a valid character boundary.
    7851             :     // (In the case where we are respecting clusters, we won't actually get
    7852             :     // this far because the low surrogate is also marked as non-clusterStart
    7853             :     // so we'll return FALSE above.)
    7854           1 :     uint32_t offs = aIter.GetOriginalOffset();
    7855           1 :     const nsTextFragment* frag = aFrame->GetContent()->GetText();
    7856           1 :     uint32_t ch = frag->CharAt(offs);
    7857             : 
    7858           1 :     if (gfxFontUtils::IsVarSelector(ch) ||
    7859           1 :         (NS_IS_LOW_SURROGATE(ch) && offs > 0 &&
    7860           1 :          NS_IS_HIGH_SURROGATE(frag->CharAt(offs - 1)))) {
    7861             :       return false;
    7862             :     }
    7863             : 
    7864             :     // If the proposed position is before a high surrogate, we need to decode
    7865             :     // the surrogate pair (if valid) and check the resulting character.
    7866           1 :     if (NS_IS_HIGH_SURROGATE(ch) && offs + 1 < frag->GetLength()) {
    7867           1 :       uint32_t ch2 = frag->CharAt(offs + 1);
    7868           1 :       if (NS_IS_LOW_SURROGATE(ch2)) {
    7869           1 :         ch = SURROGATE_TO_UCS4(ch, ch2);
    7870             :         // If the character is a (Plane-14) variation selector,
    7871             :         // or a Regional Indicator character that is ligated with the previous
    7872             :         // character, this is not a valid boundary.
    7873           1 :         if (gfxFontUtils::IsVarSelector(ch) ||
    7874           0 :             (gfxFontUtils::IsRegionalIndicator(ch) &&
    7875           0 :              !aTextRun->IsLigatureGroupStart(index))) {
    7876             :           return false;
    7877             :         }
    7878             :       }
    7879             :     }
    7880             :   }
    7881             :   return true;
    7882             : }
    7883             : 
    7884             : nsIFrame::FrameSearchResult
    7885           1 : nsTextFrame::PeekOffsetCharacter(bool aForward, int32_t* aOffset,
    7886             :                                  bool aRespectClusters)
    7887             : {
    7888           1 :   int32_t contentLength = GetContentLength();

    7890             :

    7892           1 :   IsSelectable(&selectStyle);

    7894             :     return CONTINUE_UNSELECTABLE;
    7895             :

    8768             : static bool
    8769           1 : HasSoftHyphenBefore(const nsTextFragment* aFrag, const gfxTextRun* aTextRun,
    8770             :                     int32_t aStartOffset, const gfxSkipCharsIterator& aIter)
    8771             : {
    8772           1 :   if (aIter.GetSkippedOffset() < aTextRun->GetLength() &&

    8774             :     return true;
    8775             :   }
    8776           1 :   if (!(aTextRun->GetFlags() & nsTextFrameUtils::TEXT_HAS_SHY))
    8777             :     return false;
    8778           1 :   gfxSkipCharsIterator iter = aIter;
    8779           1 :   while (iter.GetOriginalOffset() > aStartOffset) {
    8780           1 :     iter.AdvanceOriginal(-1);
    8781           1 :     if (!iter.IsOriginalCharSkipped())
    8782             :       break;

    8788             : 
    8789             : /**
    8790             :  * Removes all frames from aFrame up to (but not including) aFirstToNotRemove,
    8791             :  * because their text has all been taken and reflowed by earlier frames.
    8792             :  */
    8793             : static void
    8794           1 : RemoveEmptyInFlows(nsTextFrame* aFrame, nsTextFrame* aFirstToNotRemove)
    8795             : {
    8796             :   NS_PRECONDITION(aFrame != aFirstToNotRemove, "This will go very badly");
    8797             :   // We have to be careful here, because some RemoveFrame implementations
    8798             :   // remove and destroy not only the passed-in frame but also all its following
    8799             :   // in-flows (and sometimes all its following continuations in general).  So
    8800             :   // we remove |f| and everything up to but not including firstToNotRemove from
    8801             :   // the flow first, to make sure that only the things we want destroyed are
    8802             :   // destroyed.
    8803             : 
    8804             :   // This sadly duplicates some of the logic from
    8805             :   // nsSplittableFrame::RemoveFromFlow.  We can get away with not duplicating
    8806             :   // all of it, because we know that the prev-continuation links of
    8807             :   // firstToNotRemove and f are fluid, and non-null.
    8808             :   NS_ASSERTION(aFirstToNotRemove->GetPrevContinuation() ==
    8809             :                aFirstToNotRemove->GetPrevInFlow() &&
    8810             :                aFirstToNotRemove->GetPrevInFlow() != nullptr,
    8811             :                "aFirstToNotRemove should have a fluid prev continuation");
    8812             :   NS_ASSERTION(aFrame->GetPrevContinuation() ==
    8813             :                aFrame->GetPrevInFlow() &&
    8814             :                aFrame->GetPrevInFlow() != nullptr,
    8815             :                "aFrame should have a fluid prev continuation");
    8816             : 
    8817           1 :   nsTextFrame* prevContinuation = aFrame->GetPrevContinuation();
    8818           1 :   nsTextFrame* lastRemoved = aFirstToNotRemove->GetPrevContinuation();
    8819             : 
    8820           1 :   for (nsTextFrame* f = aFrame; f != aFirstToNotRemove;
    8821             :        f = f->GetNextContinuation()) {
    8822             :     // f is going to be destroyed soon, after it is unlinked from the
    8823             :     // continuation chain. If its textrun is going to be destroyed we need to
    8824             :     // do it now, before we unlink the frames to remove from the flow,
    8825             :     // because DestroyFrom calls ClearTextRuns() and that will start at the
    8826             :     // first frame with the text run and walk the continuations.
    8827           1 :     if (f->IsInTextRunUserData()) {
    8828           0 :       f->ClearTextRuns();
    8829             :     } else {
    8830           1 :       f->DisconnectTextRuns();
    8831             :     }
    8832             :   }
    8833             : 
    8834           1 :   prevContinuation->SetNextInFlow(aFirstToNotRemove);
    8835           1 :   aFirstToNotRemove->SetPrevInFlow(prevContinuation);
    8836             : 
    8837           1 :   aFrame->SetPrevInFlow(nullptr);
    8838           1 :   lastRemoved->SetNextInFlow(nullptr);

    8853             : 
    8854             : void
    8855           1 : nsTextFrame::SetLength(int32_t aLength, nsLineLayout* aLineLayout,
    8856             :                        uint32_t aSetLengthFlags)
    8857             : {
    8858           1 :   mContentLengthHint = aLength;
    8859           1 :   int32_t end = GetContentOffset() + aLength;
    8860           1 :   nsTextFrame* f = GetNextInFlow();
    8861           1 :   if (!f)
    8862             :     return;
    8863             : 
    8864             :   // If our end offset is moving, then even if frames are not being pushed or
    8865             :   // pulled, content is moving to or from the next line and the next line
    8866             :   // must be reflowed.
    8867             :   // If the next-continuation is dirty, then we should dirty the next line now
    8868             :   // because we may have skipped doing it if we dirtied it in
    8869             :   // CharacterDataChanged. This is ugly but teaching FrameNeedsReflow
    8870             :   // and ChildIsDirty to handle a range of frames would be worse.
    8871           1 :   if (aLineLayout &&
    8872           1 :       (end != f->mContentOffset || (f->GetStateBits() & NS_FRAME_IS_DIRTY))) {
    8873             :     aLineLayout->SetDirtyNextLine();
    8874             :   }
    8875             : 
    8876           1 :   if (end < f->mContentOffset) {
    8877             :     // Our frame is shrinking. Give the text to our next in flow.
    8878           1 :     if (aLineLayout &&
    8879           1 :         HasSignificantTerminalNewline() &&
    8880           1 :         GetParent()->GetType() != nsGkAtoms::letterFrame &&
    8881           1 :         (aSetLengthFlags & ALLOW_FRAME_CREATION_AND_DESTRUCTION)) {
    8882             :       // Whatever text we hand to our next-in-flow will end up in a frame all of
    8883             :       // its own, since it ends in a forced linebreak.  Might as well just put
    8884             :       // it in a separate frame now.  This is important to prevent text run
    8885             :       // churn; if we did not do that, then we'd likely end up rebuilding
    8886             :       // textruns for all our following continuations.
    8887             :       // We skip this optimization when the parent is a first-letter frame
    8888             :       // because it doesn't deal well with more than one child frame.
    8889             :       // We also skip this optimization if we were called during bidi
    8890             :       // resolution, so as not to create a new frame which doesn't appear in
    8891             :       // the bidi resolver's list of frames
    8892           1 :       nsPresContext* presContext = PresContext();
    8893             :       nsIFrame* newFrame = presContext->PresShell()->FrameConstructor()->
    8894           1 :         CreateContinuingFrame(presContext, this, GetParent());
    8895           1 :       nsTextFrame* next = static_cast<nsTextFrame*>(newFrame);
    8896             :       nsFrameList temp(next, next);
    8897           1 :       GetParent()->InsertFrames(kNoReflowPrincipalList, this, temp);
    8898           1 :       f = next;
    8899             :     }
    8900             : 
    8901           1 :     f->mContentOffset = end;
    8902           1 :     if (f->GetTextRun(nsTextFrame::eInflated) != mTextRun) {
    8903           1 :       ClearTextRuns();
    8904           1 :       f->ClearTextRuns();
    8905             :     }
    8906             :     return;
    8907             :   }
    8908             :   // Our frame is growing. Take text from our in-flow(s).
    8909             :   // We can take text from frames in lines beyond just the next line.
    8910             :   // We don't dirty those lines. That's OK, because when we reflow
    8911             :   // our empty next-in-flow, it will take text from its next-in-flow and
    8912             :   // dirty that line.
    8913             : 
    8914             :   // Note that in the process we may end up removing some frames from
    8915             :   // the flow if they end up empty.
    8916             :   nsTextFrame* framesToRemove = nullptr;
    8917           1 :   while (f && f->mContentOffset < end) {
    8918           1 :     f->mContentOffset = end;
    8919           1 :     if (f->GetTextRun(nsTextFrame::eInflated) != mTextRun) {
    8920           1 :       ClearTextRuns();
    8921           1 :       f->ClearTextRuns();
    8922             :     }
    8923           1 :     nsTextFrame* next = f->GetNextInFlow();
    8924             :     // Note: the "f->GetNextSibling() == next" check below is to restrict
    8925             :     // this optimization to the case where they are on the same child list.
    8926             :     // Otherwise we might remove the only child of a nsFirstLetterFrame
    8927             :     // for example and it can't handle that.  See bug 597627 for details.
    8928           1 :     if (next && next->mContentOffset <= end && f->GetNextSibling() == next &&
    8929           1 :         (aSetLengthFlags & ALLOW_FRAME_CREATION_AND_DESTRUCTION)) {
    8930             :       // |f| is now empty.  We may as well remove it, instead of copying all
    8931             :       // the text from |next| into it instead; the latter leads to use
    8932             :       // rebuilding textruns for all following continuations.
    8933             :       // We skip this optimization if we were called during bidi resolution,
    8934             :       // since the bidi resolver may try to handle the destroyed frame later
    8935             :       // and crash
    8936           1 :       if (!framesToRemove) {
    8937             :         // Remember that we have to remove this frame.
    8938           1 :         framesToRemove = f;
    8939             :       }
    8940           1 :     } else if (framesToRemove) {
    8941           1 :       RemoveEmptyInFlows(framesToRemove, f);
    8942           1 :       framesToRemove = nullptr;
    8943             :     }
    8944           1 :     f = next;
    8945             :   }
    8946             :   NS_POSTCONDITION(!framesToRemove || (f && f->mContentOffset == end),
    8947             :                    "How did we exit the loop if we null out framesToRemove if "
    8948             :                    "!next || next->mContentOffset > end ?");
    8949           1 :   if (framesToRemove) {
    8950             :     // We are guaranteed that we exited the loop with f not null, per the
    8951             :     // postcondition above
    8952           1 :     RemoveEmptyInFlows(framesToRemove, f);
    8953             :   }
    8954             : 
    8955             : #ifdef DEBUG
    8956             :   f = this;
    8957             :   int32_t iterations = 0;
    8958             :   while (f && iterations < 10) {
    8959             :     f->GetContentLength(); // Assert if negative length
    8960             :     f = f->GetNextContinuation();

    8962             :   }
    8963             :   f = this;
    8964             :   iterations = 0;

    9048             : void
    9049           1 : nsTextFrame::ReflowText(nsLineLayout& aLineLayout, nscoord aAvailableWidth,
    9050             :                         DrawTarget* aDrawTarget,
    9051             :                         ReflowOutput& aMetrics,
    9052             :                         nsReflowStatus& aStatus)
    9053             : {
    9054             : #ifdef NOISY_REFLOW
    9055             :   ListTag(stdout);
    9056             :   printf(": BeginReflow: availableWidth=%d\n", aAvailableWidth);
    9057             : #endif
    9058             : 
    9059           1 :   nsPresContext* presContext = PresContext();
    9060             : 
    9061             : #ifdef ACCESSIBILITY
    9062             :   // Schedule the update of accessible tree since rendered text might be changed.
    9063           1 :   if (StyleVisibility()->IsVisible()) {
    9064           1 :     ReflowTextA11yNotifier(presContext, mContent);
    9065             :   }
    9066             : #endif
    9067             : 
    9068             :   /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
    9069             :   // Set up flags and clear out state
    9070             :   /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
    9071             : 
    9072             :   // Clear out the reflow state flags in mState. We also clear the whitespace

    9074             :   // or not.
    9075           1 :   RemoveStateBits(TEXT_REFLOW_FLAGS | TEXT_WHITESPACE_FLAGS);
    9076             : 
    9077             :   // Temporarily map all possible content while we construct our new textrun.
    9078             :   // so that when doing reflow our styles prevail over any part of the
    9079             :   // textrun we look at. Note that next-in-flows may be mapping the same
    9080             :   // content; gfxTextRun construction logic will ensure that we take priority.

    9085           1 :     ClearMetrics(aMetrics);
    9086           1 :     aStatus.Reset();

    9088             :   }

    9156             :

    9273             : 
    9274           1 :   int32_t limitLength = length;
    9275           1 :   int32_t forceBreak = aLineLayout.GetForcedBreakPosition(this);
    9276           1 :   bool forceBreakAfter = false;
    9277           1 :   if (forceBreak >= length) {
    9278           1 :     forceBreakAfter = forceBreak == length;
    9279             :     // The break is not within the text considered for this textframe.
    9280           1 :     forceBreak = -1;
    9281             :   }
    9282           1 :   if (forceBreak >= 0) {

    9284             :   }

    9689             :   }
    9690             : 
    9691             :   // aDeltaWidth is *subtracted* from our width.
    9692             :   // If advanceDelta is positive then setting the line break made us longer,
    9693             :   // so aDeltaWidth could go negative.
    9694           1 :   result.mDeltaWidth = NSToCoordFloor(delta - advanceDelta);
    9695             :   // If aDeltaWidth goes negative, that means this frame might not actually fit
    9696             :   // anymore!!! We need higher level line layout to recover somehow.
    9697             :   // If it's because the frame has a soft hyphen that is now being displayed,
    9698             :   // this should actually be OK, because our reflow recorded the break
    9699             :   // opportunity that allowed the soft hyphen to be used, and we wouldn't
    9700             :   // have recorded the opportunity unless the hyphen fit (or was the first
    9701             :   // opportunity on the line).
    9702             :   // Otherwise this can/ really only happen when we have glyphs with special
    9703             :   // shapes at the end of lines, I think. Breaking inside a kerning pair won't
    9704             :   // do it because that would mean we broke inside this textrun, and
    9705             :   // BreakAndMeasureText should make sure the resulting shaped substring fits.
    9706             :   // Maybe if we passed a maxTextLength? But that only happens at direction
    9707             :   // changes (so we wouldn't kern across the boundary) or for first-letter
    9708             :   // (which always fits because it starts the line!).

    9710             :                        "Negative deltawidth, something odd is happening");

    9712             : #ifdef NOISY_TRIM
    9713             :   ListTag(stdout);
    9714             :   printf(": trim => %d\n", result.mDeltaWidth);
    9715             : #endif
    9716           1 :   return result;
    9717             : }

    9753           1 : static void TransformChars(nsTextFrame* aFrame, const nsStyleText* aStyle,
    9754             :                            const gfxTextRun* aTextRun, uint32_t aSkippedOffset,
    9755             :                            const nsTextFragment* aFrag, int32_t aFragOffset,
    9756             :                            int32_t aFragLen, nsAString& aOut)
    9757             : {
    9758           1 :   nsAutoString fragString;
    9759             :   char16_t* out;

    9761             :     // No text-transform, so we can copy directly to the output string.
    9762           1 :     aOut.SetLength(aOut.Length() + aFragLen);
    9763           1 :     out = aOut.EndWriting() - aFragLen;

    9765             :     // Use a temporary string as source for the transform.
    9766           0 :     fragString.SetLength(aFragLen);
    9767           0 :     out = fragString.BeginWriting();
    9768             :   }

    9770             :   // Copy the text, with \n and \t replaced by <space> if appropriate.
    9771           1 :   for (int32_t i = 0; i < aFragLen; ++i) {
    9772           1 :     char16_t ch = aFrag->CharAt(aFragOffset + i);

    9774           0 :         (ch == '\t' && !aStyle->TabIsSignificant())) {
    9775           0 :       ch = ' ';
    9776             :     }
    9777           1 :     out[i] = ch;
    9778             :   }

    9784             :       auto transformedTextRun =

    9799           0 :       aOut.Append(fragString);
    9800             :     }
    9801             :   }

    9804             : static bool
    9805           1 : LineEndsInHardLineBreak(nsTextFrame* aFrame, nsBlockFrame* aLineContainer)
    9806             : {

    9816             : nsIFrame::RenderedText
    9817           1 : nsTextFrame::GetRenderedText(uint32_t aStartOffset,

    9820             :                              TrailingWhitespace aTrimTrailingWhitespace)
    9821             : {

    9823             :   MOZ_ASSERT(!GetPrevContinuation() ||
    9824             :              (aOffsetType == TextOffsetType::OFFSETS_IN_CONTENT_TEXT &&

    9871             :       // No soft breaks occur in this situation.
    9872             :       trimAfter = true;

    9888           0 :       if (nextOffsetInRenderedString <= aStartOffset) {
    9889             :         offsetInRenderedString = nextOffsetInRenderedString;
    9890           1 :         continue;
    9891             :       }

    9894           0 :             tmpIter.ConvertSkippedToOriginal(aStartOffset - skippedToRenderedStringOffset);

    9897             :       }
    9898           0 :       if (offsetInRenderedString >= aEndOffset) {
    9899             :         break;
    9900             :       }

    9902           1 :       if (uint32_t(textFrame->GetContentEnd()) <= aStartOffset) {
    9903             :         offsetInRenderedString = nextOffsetInRenderedString;
    9904             :         continue;
    9905             :       }
    9906           1 :       if (!haveOffsets) {
    9907           1 :         result.mOffsetWithinNodeText = aStartOffset;

    9918             :         break;
    9919             :       }

    9923             :     int32_t endOffset;

    9925             :       startOffset =
    9926           0 :         tmpIter.ConvertSkippedToOriginal(aStartOffset - skippedToRenderedStringOffset);
    9927             :       endOffset =
    9928           0 :         tmpIter.ConvertSkippedToOriginal(aEndOffset - skippedToRenderedStringOffset);

    9934           1 :         startOffset);

   10039             :       aBuf.AppendLiteral("\\r");

   10137             : nscoord
   10138           1 : nsTextFrame::GetLogicalBaseline(WritingMode aWM) const

   10141           1 :     return mAscent;

   10168             : bool
   10169           1 : nsTextFrame::ComputeCustomOverflow(nsOverflowAreas& aOverflowAreas)
   10170             : {
